column2: Lost Cemetery of Lincoln Park History Walk
column7: the super secret meeting location will be emailed to you when tickets are purchased
column8: Join historian and retired park ranger John Martini on this twilight exploration of Lincoln Park and discover forgotten funerary monuments along the golf course fairways. Few people realize that today's Lincoln Park Golf Course was once "City Cemetery," the final resting place for tens of thousands of San Franciscans, including a Chinese burial ground and the municipal paupers' graveyard called Potter's Field. The walk ends at the Palace of the Legion of Honor.

column2: Club Guillotine | Election Day 2024 Watch Party & Blood Bath Catharsis Party
column7: Ivy Room | 860 San Pablo Avenue, Albany, CA 94706
column8: COMMUNITY. CATHARSIS. CARNAGE. There will be blood! We dare you to wear your best white! This Election Day, while the nation focuses on its uncertain future, Club Guillotine at the Ivy Room offers a night of dark humor, music, political satire, and community. Presented by Victoria Victrola and hosted by Ifn Whendy and Ma Shugganuttz, the event will provide a welcome escape from the election frenzy, with performances designed to channel the chaos and absurdity of the moment as we gather together in cathartic joy. We can‚Äôt heal in isolation, together we are stronger and shine brighter! Featuring powerful acts from Bay Area legends, Polly Amber Ross and Ashanti Altovese with DJ sets from Die Wies and Dakota Pendent, this high-energy, avant-garde experience will end with Shadow Circus Creature Theatre‚Äôs midnight Guillotine Stage Show where puppet versions of our most reviled political figures will meet their bloody, fateful end.  For those looking to blow off steam from the day's tensions, this event will combine artistry, performance, and a touch of the grotesque in an absurd take on power, performance, and the theater of politics Dance. Lose your head. We'll treat you like royalty! Don't miss the bloodiest, most unforgettable night of 2024!

column2: "Coarse Men Talk Outside My Window" by David Enos at HIT Gallery Nov 9th
column8: "Coarse Men Talk Outside My Window" is a collection of works in gouache and marker by San Francisco artist David Enos. Join us for the opening reception at HIT Gallery on November 9th from 5-8. "Coarse Men Talk Outside My Window" draws on the sights and sounds observed and imagined while living in the Mission's Liberty Hill district.  "An alleyway invites clandestine behavior," Katie once said, and this was true about San Carlos Street.  There were beautiful times and a warmth to the neighborhood, and other things which frightened me but were equally valuable in contributing to the richness and mystery of those years.  A woman crouched whispering in a hushed rage below my window in the middle of the night, a never-seen man sang in vibrato: "Look into my eye-eye-eye".  I never looked up whether this was an existing song or his own song.  While carrying groceries someone came from an alley and chased me most of the way home.  A man screamed "MY NAME IS JOHN FITZPATRICK" up and down the block.  The whispering was more concerning than the shouting.  The house I lived in had a super-size empty room that could be changed around easily to look different ways for filming.  The Leddy sisters across the street, Debbie Horn and her partner Paul, Hailey, Lars, Donovan, Jason, Josh, Anna Hillburg, Glenn, and Katie who I married.  All were lovely, funny, encouraging people whose voices greatly influenced my thoughts and creative work during those days and today.  I hope viewers find something to enjoy in this record of my experience of that period. "Coarse Men Talk Outside My Window" will be on display at HIT Gallery November 9-30th.

column2: James Goode, lucie R., Rot Diet, Newcomer Can't Swim
column8: James Goode Striking a resemblance to "Fifth Head" in Coalinga's own Faxed Head where one white-knuckle grips the glue while the others crank extreme tape manipulation and electronics, crazed clone James Goode under proper care proves capable of outstanding sound design for countless theater productions. And you'll find him popping up in credits of the most astonishing recordings alongside Cole Palme, Neil Hamburger, John Dieterich, Greg Saunier, Ches Smith, Trey Spruance, William Winant and many more. Don't miss your chance to see this strange head pop up solo at the Peacock heavily armed with laptop, various objects and devices even to include vocals. https://jamesgoode.bandcamp.com/music lucie R. Eyes are just the part of the brain that protrudes from the skull, bizarre outties relative to the ears, the binaural innies alongside olfaction and all the rest. Perception feeds a quivering cascade of neurons that pastiche a survivable version of the present. But it promptly unglues and re-versions into eddies of real and not real, self and not-self, anticipation and memory. lucie R. acts as our collective unraveller, instigator of anarchical action escaping all forecast, forming and deforming the possible. For this storm, inside the Peacock Lounge, all bets are off. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AzS6-fCVrz4 Newcomer Can't Swim Newcomer Can‚Äôt Swim. For midnight. Contents. Untitled, park in city. ‚ÄúOakland/San Francisco foursome‚Äù ‚Äúunder witness protection‚Äù ‚Äúsuddenly decided to play scratch music so hard, that the balloon burst.‚Äù Severely deconstructed ‚ÄúThe Water is Wide‚Äù with abject blowout. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=juWZWuJdB5M Rot Diet How can a shape sit inside something infinite? Doesn't something infinite need a body in order to hold? But the body moves away from living, from the flesh and bone of life, and becomes regions. Renouncing essences or absolutes Mitch Stahlmann and Chris Farstad may brandish cracklebox and electronic wind instrument, but really nothing is needed other than infinity and nowhere. Somewhere between sits the Peacock Lounge and inside sits you and inside sits silence and inside sits sound. That is, if you can be there at all.https://555sounds.bandcamp.com/

column2: I keep forgetting there is a wall
column7: Your MOod Projects, Noonan Building Pier 70 Dogpatch
column8: I started photographing the wall in 2016. I stopped photographing it obsessively in 2019. After my dad passed. The wall reminds me of our calls. The wall was my anxiety around losing my dad. The wall was my first friend in San Francisco. The wall reminds me of my age. My first work with repetition. And it‚Äôs still ongoing. Though inconsistent. The wall is a witness. Is everything we see and never pay attention to. The wall is all walls. The wall is a wall. It‚Äôs big and invisible. Magic. In 2024, everything changed but the wall. The wall is constant. ‚Äî @ebtiebtiebti

column2: The Glory of Love: a non-ironic one-woman lovesong changework cabaret matinee
column8: Kellita Maloof, devoted conscious cabaret performing artist and mentor, dishes up a reprisal of her first full-length lovesong cabaret, infused with her signature earnestness, whimsy + heartfelt spontaneity. This is Changework Cabaret. You will be invited to FEEL what it feels like to be YOU while you witness Kellita doing the the very same thing, while she also ushers you on a journey through the many faces of love, from the personal to the universal. Expect to smile, laugh ... and perhaps shed a tear or two, as our stops include Love as Wonder, Love as Longing, Love as Gratitude, Love as Watch-Out-Here-I Come, Love as Tenderness, Love as Passion, Love as Reverie, Love as Fuck-No-Stop-Right-There, Love as Join-Me-In-The Dance.Delight in tributes to Edith Piaf, Leonard Cohen, Tom Jobim, Violetta Parra, George Gershwin, Cat Stevens and more. Songs sung in English, Spanish, Portuguese and French. The songs themselves are spells, in the very best sense of the word. These stories, encased in melodies, cast Fields of Feeling, that invite each human in the room to embody more of their own true nature and essence.

column8: Baddest. Cowboy. Texas. These are just a few words to describe the Baddest Cowboy in Texas. He roots n‚Äô toots n‚Äô roots from the mightiest mountains to the sauciest saloons. But what happens when a Badder Cowboy-er Texas-er (AKA his nemesis) rides into town and steals his title?BANGTAIL is an epic tale of a man in search of his manhood. So saddle up for an hour of unbridled cowboy clown chaos as our hero journeys from the Wild West to the American office. Fresh from a sold out tour in the US (March 2024), a sold-out run in Edinburgh, and a transfer to SOHO Theatre in London BANGTAIL is back in his home territory and ‚Ä¶ dare he say it ‚Ä¶ on the road again!

column7: SF Columbarium, 1 Loraine Ct, San Francisco, CA 94118
column8: We‚Äôre excited to be presenting a concert in a new space - the San Francisco Columbarium! A beautiful, historic building dating to the late 1890s that houses the legacy of generations of San Franciscans. Being invited to bring music into such a sacred space is allowing us to reflect on a different part of the cycle than we normally focus on. Not inception, newness, or innovation, but memory, peace, and the transition into whatever the next thing may be.

Art Unification Theory (AUT) brings together a groundbreaking set of tools designed to embrace the full complexity of art‚ÄîALL art‚Äîthrough the lenses of empathy and critical thinking. Through this interactive presentation and discussion, AUT will empower you to have richer, more resonant encounters with art, and you will leave equipped to articulate those experiences clearly. It‚Äôs insightful, it‚Äôs witty, it‚Äôs useful, it's fun, and it‚Äôs deeply human. It‚Äôs real. And it‚Äôs made for you. We‚Äôll save you a seat.

column2: Evening of experimental sound with Roco C√≥rdova, John Davis, Christopher Robin Duncan
column7: Beauty Supply Arts - DM For Address
column8: Born in San Juan, Puerto Rico, Roco C√≥rdova is a vocalist, composer, producer, and improviser based in the San Francisco Bay Area. Roco‚Äôs work fuses diverse influences with electronic media, noise, and improvisation, featuring extended vocal techniques like throat singing, overtone singing, and falsetto. Their performances, blending voice and technology, create a timeless experience that transcends conventional boundaries, merging ritual and performance. Through live performance, studio projects, workshops and residencies, John Davis is focused on work that encourages sensory response through unexpected uses of traditional media. As a musician, he works with stringed, percussion, and electronic instruments, and his music has been released on the Root Strata, Digitalis, Students of Decay, Bimodal Press and Peasant Magik labels in the US, and the obs label, Rostov On Don, Russia. Christopher Robin Duncan (born 1974-Perth Amboy, New Jersey) is muliti-media artist based  in Oakland, California. Duncan utilizes the Sun and the Moon, the Ocean, as well as Time and Tide as conceptual and compositional prompts for experiments in sonic and visual endeavors.  Sonically- Duncan creates an expansive, lush web of tones, marking time with harmonica, electronics, percussion, a series of handbuilt ceramic instruments and field recordings.

column2: Shellmound to Shellmound 3 Mile Prayer Walk
column8: This year‚Äôs annual Shellmound 2 Shellmound Prayer walk will honor the legacy of beloved warrior Wounded Knee De‚ÄôOcampo who transitioned on October 7th 2024. Wounded Knee was known for showing up for the people, being a water protector and for being a part of The Longest Walk that began in 1978, starting from the Bay Area to Washington D.C. Wounded Knee was also monumental in the movements to protect sacred sites, one of those sites being Sogorea Te‚Äô, which is now known as Glen Cove in Vallejo.Through this work Wounded Knee reached people from various communities around the world and so many people will feel the impact from this great loss. The work that Wounded Knee has done in the protection of sacred sites will continue to live on through all who knew and loved him. #protectthesacred #protectsacredsites #thelongestwalker

column2: Matt Ingalls, Adult Math, Foot SOS, Korber/Diaz
column7: Peacock Lounge, 552 Haight Street, SF, CA
column8: Matt Ingalls The sizzle of a fuse, the certainty of combustion, as complexity folds and refolds expanding apace within well-honed confines of Ingalls' sonic vernacular. Soon you realize, that tingle you feel is temporal. It's not your hairs at all that are standing on end but angels bristling on the pinhead of your mind's eye. When this virtuoso of reeds and circuits lights the fuse, improvisations brighten then burn with direction like spontaneous composition. Minds are about to be blown. http://sfsound.org/matt.html | https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wZuEoY1mkMQ Adult Math The bell! It's final exams and Miles Stegall is that heart-on-sleeve pupil for whom it all unspools, transfixing his peers as they see his every effort draw the enraged attention of a livid teacher. Remediation, re-failure, detention, jammed locker, Christmas is cancelled. Then you wonder if poisoning the holidays wasn't his secret scheme all along. Torturing that teacher, smiling from the stockades, the student becomes the sadist. If Stegall's infamous music history with Mono Pause, Neung Phak, and his collaborations with the likes of James Goode or Malcolm Mooney and the 10th Planet are any clue, and they are... we've all been had.

column2: Latitude Society: ARG Movie Series Pt.2
column7: Cat Factory (next to 16th St Bart); exact address sent to Going RSVP day-of
column8: Curious about Alternate Reality Games? A new renaissance is upon us, co-expanding with the rise of escape rooms, immersive art parties with theatrical  experiences, alongside the many Meow Wolf‚Äôs of the world. One might argue that Fluxus did it first, but Nonchalance really put this type of experience on the modern map in 2008 with The Jejune Institute. The high production sequel ARG, The Latitude Society more secretively invited players to an elaborate world of San Francisco‚Äôs underground. Come check out the 90min documentary film ‚ÄúIn Bright Axiom‚Äù that tells the tale! I personally have several souvenirs to share. Bring your own if you do too. üéñÔ∏èMovie Start Time ~7:45pm Join us in our theater, enjoy our popcorn, feel free to BYOB drinks / snacks / dinner, and stick around to discuss the latest happenings in this field. Just in time for this Friday‚Äôs shenanigans ;) Later parts of this series will include the rest from Nonchalance: Dispatches from Elsewhere SYGNYL Also, the Meow Wolf documentary and any others on-topic that you might recommend üò∏Important Health & Allergy Notes: We have 5 real cats at the Cat Factory - if you are allergic be advised to take antihistamines beforehand.Covid: please take a rapid test day-of if you have been recently exposed, and don‚Äôt attend if you are exhibiting signs of any contagious sickness or been recently exposed.

We explore the phenomenon of stigmergy, and honor the beaver for its contributions in legend, myth and present day.

column2: Berkeley Balkan Bacchanal Presents Krekhts & Duygu and Friends
column7: Starry Plough, 3101 Shattuck Ave, Berkeley, CA 94705-1822, United States
column8: The Berkeley Balkan Bacchanal PresentsA krekhts (◊ß◊®◊¢◊õ◊•) is a crack ‚Äì a shrill cry of the clarinet, a break in the voice. An imperfection, but one which comes straight from the heart.Krekhts is a rough and ready Berkeley psychoklezmer band that sifts through the deep drawers of Klezmer history ‚Äî from the factory floor to the cheapest seats in the Second Avenue cabaret, to the Borscht Belt and the Yiddish radio. They play frenetic bulgars and soul-wrenching ballads in mameloshn (Yiddish), medineh-loshn (English) and loshnkoydesh (Hebrew). Mike Tal (guitar), Binya K√≥atz (vocals), Atid Kimelman (clarinet), Aaron Goldstein (drums/vocals), Daniel Goldberg (alto sax), and Seng Chen (bass) forge gelt from the Yiddish past to pave the way towards the joyously liberated Yiddish future. Featuring special guest Ilya Kreymer on accordion.Duygu & Friends is a dynamic ensemble celebrating the music of Anatolia and the Aegean, offering folksy interpretations of Turkish popular and classical songs. With its evolving lineup and creative collaborations, the group brings fresh energy to traditional sounds. For their upcoming performance at the Berkeley Balkan Bacchanal, the core duo Duygu G√ºn on guitar and vocals, and Peter Bonos on oud and trumpet, will be joined by Faisal Zedan on percussion and Marco Ghezzo on violin, accompanied by captivating belly dancing by Melike ≈ûeng√ºl. Duygu G√ºn is a musician, community advocate, creative producer, and cultural connector dedicated to preserving and sharing folk traditions. She was raised in Mersin, T√ºrkiye and is currently based in San Francisco, California.

We all know the story: The redemption of a cranky miser at Christmas, a ghost story designed to let an audience feel good about themselves for not being heartless. But Charles Dickens wasn't trying to make people feel good, he was trying to show them a stark reality, scaring them into being more human. He wrote "A Christmas Carol" to shake up society, and with A Red Carol we are re-establishing his story as the revolutionary call-to-action Dickens intended.

column2: Japanese New Year Bell Ringing Ceremony
column8: Ring in the New Year by taking a swing at a 2,100-pound, 16th-century Japanese temple bell. Led by Reverend Gengo Akiba, this inspiring ceremony will include a purification ritual and chanting of the Buddhist Heart Sutra. Visitors will have an opportunity to ring the bell to leave behind any unfortunate experiences, regrettable deeds, or ill luck from the year. The bell will be struck 108 times to usher in the New Year and curb the 108 mortal desires (bonno) that, according to Buddhist belief, torment humankind.

column2: Polar Plunge and World Naked Bike Ride-San Francisco, Plunge & Beach Party.
column7: Ocean Beach, The Great Highway & Taraval, San Francisco, CA
column8: Since 2011, the Riptide Bar on Taraval sponsored Polar Plunge that has drawn 400 or more people every year. It stands to reason several hundred will show up to plunge, whether or not the sponsors are there to host it. So let's do this. On New Years Day, starting at 10:30 am, begin gathering at the intersection of Taraval and the Great Highway. Beginning and ending at Taraval has worked out well and gives us two laps on the Great Highway, so this is where we will continue to meet for the New Years Day Polar Plunge World Naked Bike Ride. If it isn't raining, then we'll ride down to the Lincoln end of the Great Highway up to the Cliff House, turn around and head to Sloat by the zoo and back to Taraval. Then we will go down onto Ocean Beach to participate in the Polar Plunge. If the weather is good, we'll stay around afterwards for our Annual WNBR-SF New Years Day Beach Party. If it is raining; we'll plunge and we're done. In past years, many of us have headed up Taraval to some warm libations at the Riptide. It's a great place to meet new friends and introduce fellow plungers to the upcoming World Naked Bike Ride season. As always, nudity is optional; ride as bare as you dare. See less

column7: The Bombay Beach Institute of Industrial Espionage & Post-Apocalyptic Studies
column8: Do you feel out of place in a crumbling society? Do you need a break from consensual reality? Do you desire a sojourn to the Sea, where the winds blow differently and the conspirators gather plentifully?

Our whole life is an expression of who we are. How we dress, how we communicate, what we buy, how we decorate our home‚Äî all of it points to the values that we unknowingly or knowingly embody. This workshop is a space to recognize the parts of our expression that have been stifled‚Äî not speaking our truth to someone we love, not going for that job we want or not stepping onto our unique path although it continues to call us forward. Once we acknowledge these aspects we are able to process and move this stagnant energy so that we can get clear on how we aim to show up in 2025. What didn't you express in 2024? What is holding you back from the life you dream of? What have you been putting on the back burner that is ready to be felt so that you can clear its weight and find more space in your being to align to what lights you up for the new year? Join us, January 2nd as we come together as community to take a look behind us to acknowledge, express and release and in doing so, access the space within ourselves to take in the seeds of inspiration that surround us and birth a new year.This is a guided practice in an intimate and cozy container for those ready to get clear and pull their dream life a little closer to themselves, actualizing and manifesting your excitements by making more energetic space for them.Bring a notebook and something to write with, an open mind, and the desire to connect and crystalize your forward momentum in the direction of your choice. There will be journaling, connection, and a lightly guided movement practice. No experience necessary. About your facilitator: Bri is an embodiment and integration life coach, breathwork and meditation guide, community builder, ceremonialist and artist dedicated to supporting the realization of a more connected, compassionate and conscious world through community building, healing expression and the cultivation of a deeper sense of loving awareness toward self and others. She does this with an array of community events in the healing arts, sacred ceremony facilitation, integrative coaching and her own healing expression. She is passionate about supporting her community to feel empowered as the creators and lovers of their lives. brianahata.com Where: This 1.5 hr workshop will be held in the temple events space of The Alchemy Society, a growing community whose aim is to inspire transformation, connect and healing expression amongst all who enter. Venmo $22 to @brianahatta with your name and email address

column8: A miniature choreography of visual poetry, objects and body parts, Book of Dew weaves a spider web of fantastical fragments. Book of Dew is a very small show. At the intersection of abstract puppetry, miniature choreography, and fairytales, this intimately staged performance features a 6'x6‚Äô wall, in which small doors open and close to reveal fleeting glimpses of visceral imagery and dancing poems. It lasts for 45 minutes. Created by Bay Area-based artists, Book of Dew makes its North American professional premiere after a sold-out run in the Edinburgh Festival Fringe 2024.

column2: Falsettos & Sunsets with Luz Gaxiola & Marlo Winter
column8: A gay clown show about polyamory??!!?! I mean, could you even THINK of something more deliciously San Francisco?! Invite the whole polycule - or triad, or quad, or hey, if you're solo poly, come too - to the playful and loving display of the idiosyncrasies of modern dating. And guess what - we have  POLYCULE TICKET DEALS!! Falsettos and Sunsets is the story of Richard Begaldix and George Lamps, a pair of cartoony cool guys who fall in love and stumble through the world of polyamory with outrageous physical comedy, startling emotional honesty, and slapstick existential confusion. Marlo Winter and Luz Gaxiola created characters Richard Begaldix and George Lamps for an Antiques Roadshow themed aerial variety show in spring of 2021 where George juggled porcelain beaver figurines, Richard appraised them, and they fell in love. After that they appeared as sandwich salesmen, song and dance men, and arms dealers in Lord Franzannian‚Äôs Royal Olympian Spectacular Vaudeville Show in 2021 and 2022. Marlo and Luz created their full-length show Falsettos and Sunsets in December 2023 with the intention of lampooning polyamory culture in a thoughtful way through clowning and risque humor.

column2: Marshall Trammell, Troglodistes, Bat Noise, Raub Roy
column7: Peacock Lounge, 552 Haight St, SF, CA
column8: Marshall Trammell The marquee might bear his name, but amidst the rubble of art authorship or object ownership Marshall Trammell is dedicated to collective creativity where ritual and art always involve all. If the ancients imagined their lives were seen by gods, recently we pose individually to an internalized technology, the social corporate-state as impassive witness. As server farms burn then rust, the self falters then finds itself once more face-to-face, in community. Join the performing audience tonight inside the Peacock Lounge to help realize "Listen Like Lovers: The Pedagogy of the Surveilled" a developing strategy in continuum with recent gatherings of Levantine and North African immigrants living in Amsterdam who developed a visual score that will be placed in your hands, to be interpreted in real-time with all the performers on tonight's bill, and you, the avant-garde as hope for a future able to behold it.TroglodistesLiz Allbee, Jason Stamberger, and Jake Rodriguez bear gifts of futures past, some assembly required because what's about to go down will be hard to believe unless you're inside the Peacock Lounge with them. Forged in the Bay Area underground back in 1996 when Stamberger (Crack W.A.R., Earwicker) and Allbee (Mute Socialite, Neung Phak) first performed together eventually forming the short-lived legendary band Le Flange du Mal. Then in 2003, the menacing mesomorph of Jake Rodriguez (bran(...)pos, Compomicro-Dexall) intersected their orbit which rocketed from house-show basements to mainstage theaters across decades and thousands of miles. This rare live session will be Allbee's only Bay Area show, occasioned by a visit from her home in Berlin. Since relocating, she has worked with George Lewis, Felix Kubin, Axel Dorner, Magda Mayas, and John Butcher so the labyrinth of her trumpet could be said to stretch all the way from there to golden age of Zeek Sheck, Hans Grusel, and Amber Asylum. If the past suggests the future, expect to hear superextended trumpet, plangent synthesizers, possibly a cello, tympani, or electric bass. When an ocean this deep gets churning, there's no guessing what monsterous gifts may heave up.

column2: Falsettos & Sunsets with Luz Gaxiola & Marlo Winter
column8: A gay clown show about polyamory??!!?! I mean, could you even THINK of something more deliciously San Francisco?! Invite the whole polycule - or triad, or quad, or hey, if you're solo poly, come too - to the playful and loving display of the idiosyncrasies of modern dating. And guess what - we have  POLYCULE TICKET DEALS!! Falsettos and Sunsets is the story of Richard Begaldix and George Lamps, a pair of cartoony cool guys who fall in love and stumble through the world of polyamory with outrageous physical comedy, startling emotional honesty, and slapstick existential confusion. Marlo Winter and Luz Gaxiola created characters Richard Begaldix and George Lamps for an Antiques Roadshow themed aerial variety show in spring of 2021 where George juggled porcelain beaver figurines, Richard appraised them, and they fell in love. After that they appeared as sandwich salesmen, song and dance men, and arms dealers in Lord Franzannian‚Äôs Royal Olympian Spectacular Vaudeville Show in 2021 and 2022. Marlo and Luz created their full-length show Falsettos and Sunsets in December 2023 with the intention of lampooning polyamory culture in a thoughtful way through clowning and risque humor.

A guided movement practice for female identifying folks to connect to, untether, and express the divinity of their bodies and all that encompass the spiritual experience of being a human. In Greek mythology, Hedone is personified as a goddess of pleasure, enjoyment, and delight, as the daughter born from the union of Eros (personification of love) and Psyche (personification of the soul). She was associated more specifically with sensual pleasure.What does it mean to embody your pleasure? To move without restraint and allow the divinity that you are to be expressed in the body that you were gifted? Can you let go of the ‚Äúself‚Äù you have created and trust the wisdom of your body, your movement, your soul? Can you allow yourself to both witness and be witnessed by others in their ecstasy? Can you meet the parts of yourself that stop you from expressing freely with compassion or at the very least with presence and curiosity? What does it even mean to move freely? Can you access that in this lifetime? Are you willing to try? Join us, as we gather on this Wolf Full Moon to experiment with tapping into the essence of the Divine Feminine; our freeform expression. This is a space for those curious about the natural movements that our bodies crave and serves as an invitation to open our channels to take in and release on deeper levels utilizing the art of dance, ceremony and energy of the full moon. meditation cushion, ect.)

column2: Somatic Practices to Supercharge Sexual Chemistry on Dates & in Relationship
column7: The Davon Method Loft- 21st and Harrison in SF
column8: Are you ready to ignite the spark of connection and intimacy, for real? ‚ÄúSomatic Practices to Supercharge Sexual Chemistry on Dates & in Relationship‚Äù is your invitation to discover the art and science of creating powerful, authentic intimacy. This engaging workshop is for singles and couples looking to elevate their love lives with transformative tools that blend science and embodiment.How do you get in your body? The missing ingredient in most relationships and in building chemistry is being fully present in your body. In this workshop, you‚Äôll learn somatic practices‚Äîpractical, accessible techniques you can do anywhere, alone or with a partner. We‚Äôll outline our signature touching practices, designed to awaken your senses and deepen connection. While this isn‚Äôt a hands-on tantra class, it captures the essence of embodied awareness, connection, and chemistry. In this workshop, you will: Discover how to tune into your body‚Äôs natural wisdom to foster authentic connections. Learn powerful techniques to increase sexual chemistry on dates and in relationships.Practice presence and attunement skills that transform the way you interact.Explore tools for releasing blocks to pleasure and connection. What‚Äôs stopping you from creating the chemistry you desire? Discover what‚Äôs missing, uncover blockages, and step into a more passionate, connected love life. Whether single or partnered, this workshop is your gateway to deeper connection and joy! Following the workshop, we will transition into unstructured social time with drinks and snacks so you can enjoy connecting with the other participants and connecting with Alicia & Erwan!

‚ÄãPharmaceutical executives are just drug dealers dressed up in suits. They pump us full of methamphetamines and antidepressants and opiates and the bankers keep the money spigot flowing. ‚ÄãWhat would a different kind of world look like? One where grassroots drug dealers could make medicines as opposed to numbing agents. One where we work with biology to shift from the megacorp world we exist in, to one that allows us to create drugs that unlock the mind, body and spirit. ‚ÄãIn this immersive experiential rave, come prepared to join in the underground movement to biohack the planet.

column8: Patricia DeFonte & DeFonte Law‚Äôs tagline is Estate Planning with Heart¬Æ and she means it, from the bottom of hers. With a great passion for serving the LGBTQ+ community, she‚Äôs the lawyer for us. De Fonte Law PC‚Äôs health care directives contain provisions related to respect for gender identification, the importance of working with medical providers who respect and/or are part of the LGBT+ community, and the importance of avoiding a ‚Äúre-closeting‚Äù during a period of infirmity.‚Ä®‚Ä®Many older individual are estranged from their families, have lost loved ones to illness, and were precluded from having children, which can make selecting a successor and agents difficult. Often, single people do not think estate planning is important or do not feel ready because they are unsure who should receive their assets. ‚Ä®‚Ä®Get your sh*t sorted with a caring professional on your side at Oasis!

Head over to the Church you wish was married to state, Church of Clown, for Good Ol‚Äô American Satire: an evening of political comedy by clowns and queens you‚Äôll love to hate while they fly our Americana Pride high in the sky. The Goddamned King of America will be there, delivering blistering satire that blurs the line between laughter and discomfort, shining an unforgiving light on the forces that shape the political soul of rural America and beyond. On the other end of the spectrum, we‚Äôll have Miss American Dream herself, faux fox news cheerleader Blanca Fiberton delivering thought provoking snacks about immigration, romance, gun control, babies, dating, sex, and popcorn!  Masculinity will be showcased, billionaires will be eaten, and we‚Äôll face these next years of America the best way we know how: through laughter and coming together. Featuring performances by: Sierra Camille, Dan Griffiths, Cherry Cola, Sophia Tavasieff, Isadora Sharon, Vitalia F. and Jamin Jollo.

column2: Beyond the Fourth Wall: Introduction to Interactive Performance with Josh Matthews
column8: Ahh, the one thing they never taught us in theatre school: HOW TO INTERACT WITH THE AUDIENCE. How do I play with this terrifying monolith of unpredictability?! Take Josh Matthew‚Äôs workshop and find out!The clown's relationship to the audience is at the heart of what makes this theatrical style vibrant and powerful. Audience participation and interaction is rarely focused on in clown training and this element of performance is so valued when well done. Oftentimes audience engagement is under rehearsed because it is hard to simulate. In this workshop we will explore techniques, methodology and practical skills of working with audience participants, creating interactive characters and creating effective gags, games and bits that use the audience as partners in your performance.Whether you are looking to bolster your strolling characters or get comfortable working with an audience participant in an act/show this introductory workshop will help in finding connection and laughter while working in the audience. Josh Matthews (They/He) is a teacher, actor, and clown/circus performer. He has traveled around the world with his theater company, Under the Table, performing original physical comedies. Josh Has performed at The Lincoln Center (NYC), The Big Apple Circus (NYC) and Third Rail Projects (NYC) to name a few companies. Josh has been a teaching artist and guest lecturer for the past 25 years, some of the organizations Josh has worked with have been the New Victory Theater, Word For Word theater company, American Conservatory Theater,  Occidental College, Sarah Lawrence College, and New York University. Currently Josh serves as a lead clown and artistic program director for Medical Clown Project.

column2: A Philosophy of Planetary Computation: From Antikythera to Synthetic Intelligence
column7: Cowell Theater, 2 Marina Blvd, San Francisco, CA 94109
column8: The Antikythera mechanism, sometimes called the ‚Äúfirst computer,‚Äù was more than a calculator; it was also an astronomical device. Thus the birth of computation is in the orienting of intelligence to its planetary condition. From Climate Science to Synthetic Biology, this remains the case. As computation becomes planetary infrastructure, its myriad hybrid intelligences pose new challenges to fundamental philosophical questions. How does computation become more than a mere technology, but also the medium through which we ask existential questions about who, what and how we are?

Step into the playful, unpredictable, and joyfully chaotic world of clowning! This workshop explores the profound connection between the clown‚Äôs body and the animate world around them. Through the lenses of physical comedy, slapstick, knockabout, and prop play, participants will discover how to transform simple actions into moments of hilarity.We will delve into the construction of comedic bits, balancing the technical precision of gags with the raw, immediate experience of an audience. By examining the animate world and the essence of ‚Äúanimate‚Äù physicality, participants will learn to embody characters and states of being that are vibrant, instinctive, and uniquely Clown. This workshop emphasizes.

Lady Mags has been a graffiti writer since the early 2000s, gaining her chops in her home town of New York City. She really took off in 2006, when she started painting track sides in Chicago and then all over the world. She exhibited her first fine art pieces in 2012 when AmandaLynn invited her to be part of a group show at Cassel Gallery in SF. Lady Mags then co-founded Alynn-Mags, a two woman graffiti and street art crew. Together, Amandalynn and Lady Mags have painted all over the world, and been in magazines like Juxtapoz and Inked, featured in local news stories and in documentaries and shown in fine art galleries around the globe. Painting art in the street and large scale fine art pieces are her passion. Over the last two decades, Lady Mags has painted thousands of graffiti pieces in alleys, tunnels, trains, walls and more.

column8: Unlock the next level of mime artistry with Mime Flow, a workshop designed for intermediate and advanced practitioners seeking to refine their imagery and integrate written constructs into their performance. This immersive experience explores the symbiotic relationship between physical movement and narrative design, emphasizing transformational flow, line design, and dynamic expression. Participants will delve into exercises that challenge physical and mental agility, focusing on fluid transitions between images and characters. Using simple constructions,‚Äù performers will learn to create visually striking and emotionally resonant transitions and sequences that captivate audiences. Additionally, we‚Äôll explore how written constructs can serve as catalysts for mime creation, enriching performances with layered meaning and intentionality. Expect hands-on practice, feedback, and collaborative exploration of advanced techniques that will elevate your mime work to new heights. Whether your goal is to refine your craft or push the boundaries of mime as an art form, Mime Flow will provide the tools and inspiration to expand your creative horizons.

column2: Vocal Bath: Sounds of –ñ, Kayla & Marissa in an Echoing Tunnel
column7: 75 Hagiwara Tea Garden Dr San Francisco, CA 94118 United States
column8: Welcome strange eYe  Entre the sound window and be vocally bathed... Recreated acapella by a small group of vocalists, be bathed in the reverberated lush hum of the human voice and hear the music of –ñ in a style you have never heard.   Hear also baroque vocal works from famous composers including Cum Dederit by Vivaldi and a catholic chant sung in old slavonic. Performed by professional vocalists in a highly unusual setting, we aim to create an unforgettable sonance.  Inspired by "Singing in Tunnels with Strangers & Sisters", an album created from recordings of improvised group singing in echoing places in San Francisco, hear new compositions and old.   This event is about sound.   The venue in near pitch darkness, under lowlight, allow your senses to become diminished, all except your ears, and flood your body in liquid voca shade.  . . .

column2: Elliott Levin Ensemble, SO AR, TanukiSpiderCat, Chlorine Aroma
column7: Peacock Lounge, 552 Haight St, SF, CA
column8: Elliott Levin is a Philly legend, poet, master of tenor sax and flute. An ESP-Disk & Ayler Records recording artist, he's played with Cecil Taylor, Odean Pope, the Sun Ra Arkestra and tonight will be joined by the Arkestra's own Kash Killion and friends who may include past collaborators Tom Rollison and Cartoon Justice. SO AR Shanna Sordahl and Robert Lopez are masters of the unwinding, the deep hang, and immersion in potential itself. Their music probes consciousness as an ever slowing flow of time. Through long walks to site specific musical collaborations with dear friends including Danishta Rivero and Jacob Heule, Aaron Oppenheim and Kevin Robinson, they find possibility in intimacy. Sordahl wields cello and electronics while Lopez embraces all manner of sonic percussion. Together they unburden perception, breathing to transform and retune awareness and in the process subverting unexamined conventions, returning potency to music and conviviality to performance. TanukiSpiderCat Colleen Twitty's solo practice has as many fangs as bright yellow eyes, all of them fixin to sink into you. From crouch to pounce, TanukiSpiderCat's blizzard of tooth, claw, fluff, cello, modular synth, and meows nudges you along to your finale with lethal-swift soft paddycakes of pure desire. Chlorine Aroma The bleeding edge of noise percussion has been flooding the gutters outside a studio marked K. Francis Messer. It's overflowing now, emptying into the deepest cisterns of the bay area underground. He feeds live drums still kicking into MaxMSP with astonishing results. Bring a band-aid for your mind, razorsharp edges inside!

column2: Feel the Future: A Valentine‚Äôs Evening with Ahmed Best
column8: This Valentine‚Äôs Day, immerse yourself in an evening of thought-provoking conversation and imagination with Ahmed Best‚Äîaward-winning actor, writer, producer, educator, and a true visionary of our shared future. From his groundbreaking role as the world‚Äôs first major CGI character actor in Star Wars to his work as a Jedi Master in The Mandalorian, Best has continually redefined the boundaries of performance and technology. But Best‚Äôs impact reaches far beyond the screen. As a pioneer in Afrofuturism and co-creator of AfroRithm Futures Group, he has dedicated his career to exploring the intersections of culture, technology, and collective imagination. Drawing from his remarkable experiences‚Äîfrom the birth of hip-hop to the forefront of the digital entertainment revolution‚ÄîBest will take us on a journey through the cultural movements that have shaped our present and illuminate how we can craft the future together. Whether you‚Äôre a Star Wars fan, an Afrofuturist thinker, or simply someone captivated by the art of possibility, this is an evening not to be missed. Celebrate love, culture, and collective vision this Valentine‚Äôs Day with The Long Now Foundation.

column8: Who: Adults ages 18 to 35 of all sexual orientations looking for love and/or friendship  On the evening of Friday, Feb. 14, BART invites adults ages 18 to 35 to join us for an on-the-rails mixer aboard a moving BART train. Ride BART into someone‚Äôs heart on a special train reserved just for this event!  It‚Äôs time to get off the apps and get on Trainder. This is speed dating ‚Äì literally. We‚Äôll help grease the wheels with icebreaker activities, conversation starters, a raffle, and BART-themed Valentines that you can give to potential connections. Adults of all sexual orientations are welcome as are those looking to make friends rather than find romance. We will have name tags with a space to write in what you are looking for. Participants must be ages 18 to 35 (we‚Äôll explore hosting a similar event for those 35+ in the future).  There will be additional staff and safety presence on each train car. BART has a zero-tolerance policy for sexual and gender-based harassment, consuming alcoholic beverages and illicit substances, and engaging in disruptive/disturbing behavior in our trains and stations. Read the full Customer Code of Conduct here. Violators will be removed from the train and face potential disciplinary action.

column8: Hold On to Your Valentine‚ÄîThings Are About to Get Spooky! Grab a flashlight and your partner‚Äôs hand, and together, explore four eerie yet hilariously haunting toy chambers, where live actors and spine-chilling surprises bring our haunted toy world to life. Solve the Mystery Uncover hidden clues in each chamber and navigate this immersive experience hand-in-hand‚Äîbecause nothing says romance like a little fear! column2: Sex Educator Showdown: Reid Mihalko vs Dr. Alison Ash
column8: What better way to learn practical sex education that you can actually use when you get home than to watch two sex educators go head-to-head and reveal their best bedroom moves?See Show-N-Tell Sex Education at its best with this Sex Educator Showdown: Dr. Alison Ash vs. Reid Mihalko! If you were a big fan of ‚ÄúI‚Äôll show you mine, if you show me yours" as a kid, or you always wished there was a reality show called ‚ÄúShagging With the Stars,‚Äù then this workshop might be for you. Tell your friends. Bring a date. Bring a notebook, too, while you‚Äôre at it! We can‚Äôt promise you reality TV level drama, but we can promise you some down-to-earth, applicable sex and relationship education, and lots of laughs. Sex Educator Showdown is a wealth of sex geekery and informative experience that you don‚Äôt want to miss. Join world-renowned sex and relationship geek Reid Mihalko of ReidAboutSex.com and celebrated, trauma-informed intimacy coach and educator Dr. Alison Ash (aka Dr. Aly) of TurnON.love for an evening of LIVE demonstrations and watch as they go hand-to-hand sharing and showing their personal stories and bedroom secrets! In this entertaining, informational, guaranteed-to-be-funny and friendly ‚Äúcompetitive‚Äù throwdown, we‚Äôll let the audience watch, take notes, ask questions, and, when the dust finally settles, connect with us and mingle with like-minded people.Show up to this fun-filled, evening workshop and learn:‚Ä¢ What sex educators do under the covers and how ‚Ä¢ Their best tips and tricks (and probably not the kind you read about in Cosmo) ‚Ä¢ Their favorite, black belt sexy-sexy time moves! ‚Ä¢ And much, much more‚Ä¶Because of Sex Educator Showdown‚Äôs sometimes explicit and frank nature and live demonstrations, no one under 18 admitted.

column2: San Jose Jazz New Works Fest: ZHENIIA
column7: San Jose Jazz: 310 S 1st St, San Jose, CA 95113
column8: New Works Fest 2025 features performances from  some of the most exciting artists in jazz, blues, R&B, soul and electronic music in the SF Bay Area. The festival is an outgrowth of SJZ‚Äôs Jazz Aid Fund initiative, which provided crucial funds to 20 artists, each to produce a new work.  Iranian-American, San Francisco based Leela Paymai is a bassist, trombonist, songwriter and arranger. Originally a classical trombonist, she expanded her horizons when she moved to San Jose in 2018. Since then, she has shifted her focus to bass and has performed with multiple jazz, salsa, classical, rock and R&B groups. Her own band, Miss Hits, has played throughout the Bay Area and has just released their debut self titled EP. In her solo work ‚ÄúZHENIIA‚Äù, she blends her jazz training with the Persian classical music she heard growing up. Her new work will be a debut of this fusion sound.

column7: Cowell Theater 2 Marina Blvd Suite 260, San Francisco, CA 94123
column8: How will AI shape our understanding of ourselves? Over the past decade, K Allado-McDowell has explored the frontiers of what they call NEURAL MEDIA ‚Äî a new technological and artistic paradigm flowering out of prior modes of broadcast and network culture. K has pioneered neural media, founding the Artists + Machine Intelligence at Google and writing books and composing operas in collaboration with non-human agents. Their work has tested the limits and potentials of these new technological forces.  Join us on February 25, 02025 at the Cowell Theater in San Francisco for a Long Now Talk from K Allado-McDowell that will showcase how our technocultural media regimes shape our creativity and self-perception. Against the backdrop of climate change and mass extinction, neural media like AI present unique challenges and opportunities.  K Allado-McDowell‚Äôs work confronts those opportunities with deep engagement, forging a path ahead to a merging of planetary, computational, and human perspectives.

column2: King Dream / Animal Prince / Ephemerald @ Ivy Room
column8: KING DREAM is a Bay Area rock ‚Äòn‚Äô roll band helmed by Oakland native Jeremy Lyon, a lifelong songwriter and multi-instrumentalist who crafts dive bar anthems with heart, brains and soul. Hard-rocking yet poignant, his music combines a love for American rock masters like Springsteen and Petty with ‚Äò60s West Coast psychedelia and more contemporary torch-bearers like My Morning Jacket and The War on Drugs ‚Äî all brought to life by a band of Northern California‚Äôs most in-demand players. ANIMAL PRINCE is the retro-pop project from singer-violinist Fae Nageon de Lestang and percussionist Grant McLeod. Fae‚Äôs vocals are a captivating instrument, drawing the listener into a landscape that‚Äôs playful yet polished, soulful but never self-serious, layered with string arrangements, synth grooves, hooks, harmonies and the occasional actual birdsong. Borrowing from bossa nova, fairy folk, yacht rock and chamber pop, Animal Prince would be at home on a mix with Caroline Polacheck, Emily King, or Feist, but the sound is uniquely their own: tender, danceable and delightfully feral.

column2: Open Mic Night - Nights at the Lab

Now more than ever, community spaces matter - our event strives to uplift and support our LGBTQ+, BIPOC, and immigrant communities.  A mic, a stage, and a room full of people willing to listen‚Äîthese moments of expression and connection remind us why we show up for each other. Whether you‚Äôre sharing a song, a poem, a story, or just coming to soak in the vibes, you‚Äôre welcome here. Follow us on Do The Bay or IG for updates! IG: @nights.at.thelab

column2: New Luddites vs. Biopiracy and AI
column8: ‚ÄúNew Luddites‚Äù Camila Morena and Jim Thomas join us fresh from the latest conference on biotech at Asilomar. Up close and deep in the international negotiations on biodiversity, climate change, and synthetic biology, both of them have seen how the proponents of AI are working to inject their techno-fantasies into every realm. They share a cogent presentation of what‚Äôs going on beyond our view, and how a new Luddism is the sensible response.

Isadora Sharon is a dynamic performer whose artistic journey encompasses dance, clown, mime, choreography, and circus arts. Born and raised in New York, they've been performing since childhood, crafting a unique style that blends classical training with avant-garde expression. Through their performances, Isadora creates work that transcends traditional boundaries, drawing audiences into a realm both timeless and otherworldly.

Sometimes asked from a place of care, others as a de facto pleasantry, that question can be difficult to answer honestly and fully, especially these days. What do you really want to say? column2: Larval Mask Workshop at Church of Clown
column8: Uncover the primal soul of your creative brain! In this play-based workshop, performers will unleash their inner dramatic narratives using classic Larval masks popularized by Jacques Lecoq. Inspired by carnival masks in Basel, Switzerland, Lecoq built bold facial shapes to train and embody worlds of new personalities within each unconventional mask. In this unique workshop at Church of Clown, mask maker and teacher Jamin Jollo will guide students through a world of improvised play using Larval/Basel masks to hone delightfully eccentric physicality and kindle the flames of character discovery.

column2: Cosmic Hiccups and the Crocodile Below
column7: The Marsh, 1062 Valencia St San Francisco CA 94110
column8: Blake was raised on magic tricks. When your dad is a magician, that‚Äôs part of a complete breakfast. But seeing so many illusions led him to an unsettling conclusion: you can‚Äôt trust your eyes (or any other organ, for that matter). So how do we proceed under such ambiguity? Probably by sweeping things under the rug. Never mind that crocodile-shaped lump over there! Join Blake as he embarks on a spiritual quest. Forecast: slightly silly with a chance of hiccups. "Cosmic Hiccups and the Crocodile Below" is the latest theatrical solo show from poet and performance artist, Blake Sugarman. As with prior shows, Blake plays himself, but the action occurs in a surreal realm where symbols come to life. Broadway World described his style as ‚Äústand-up existentialism stumbling through the looking glass.‚Äù For more info check out blakesugarman.com The piece is 20 minutes and will be presented as part of "Monday Night Marsh" with a couple other short solo works by Zoe Kat and Amy Blondell. There will be a brief talk back following the performance.

column2: Lee Black Childers 70's Punk and Glam Portraits
column8: Don't miss a chance to own an iconic photo! This is the first U.S. exhibit of seminal rock culture photographer Leee Black Childers since his passing in 2014. We are showcasing a curated selection of Childers‚Äô most impactful works, including some never-before-seen photographs that were carefully stored for decades. Visitors will experience rare images of music legends like David Bowie, Iggy Pop, Debbie Harry, Siouxsie Sioux, the New York Dolls, Patti Smith, and members of the Sex Pistols.

column7: Church of Clown (2400 Bayshore Blvd, San Francisco, CA 94134)
column8: Seeking invigoration with quirky musical madness??! The touring sensation nightmayor is Bringing Life 2 U! Bring Life 2 U is an original song and dance performance of vast scope and profound meaning. Experience the full human lifespan in only 30 minutes! This show features handmade costumes, original choreography, and unstoppable dance music, courtesy of nightmayor, the underground musical theater sensation from Olympia, Washington. Do not miss this once in a lifetime chance to see a lifetime all at once! nightmayor is a performance group based in Olympia, Washington. Since 2018 nightmayor has produced music, videos, and shows that share a surreal sense of humor and a bold aesthetic vision. Recent shows include the touring live music and dance experience Adopted Brothers: Not Related By Blood, the feature length reality TV musical The Total Package,  and the historical horror musical The Oculist.    The Bring Life 2 U tour runs from 3/5/2025 to 3/30/2025, with shows in Houston, Austin, San Marcos, Los Angeles, San Francisco, Sacramento, Eugene, Portland, Olympia, Seattle, and Quilcene. For more information please follow @plaguedbynightmayors on instagram, or visit nightmayor.online!

column2: Lived in Clothing Swap: Spring Edition
column8: Clothes are so much more than mere cloth to cover our bits and keep us warm. They do life with us, share our memories and help us express our individuality. ‚ú®But fast trend cycles, algorithms constantly throwing new shit in our faces and delusional pricing has led to a disconnect from the clothes we wear, where fashion is often regarded as disposable.  We believe that re-establishing this connection is necessary if we are to transition to an era of intentionality. Join us for a different kind of clothes swap, where we celebrate the journeys of our wardrobes and give items new life and new stories. ü§ùHave clothes you love but need a revamp? Bring those too! üë† Sabrina, the owner of the brand Blush Spice, will be offering on site embroidery and alteration services. There will be a sign up list and a flash sheet  of on-the-spot embroidery and alteration services. Flash designs wil range $25-$65 in price. Any requests or alterations that cannot be completed on site can be done at the Blush Spice studio and made available for pick up. We‚Äôll also have tunes by DJ Ewill, beverages from Coffee in Progress, and treats from Choc‚Äôlate Mama Cookie Co. ü§©

column2: Anything But Plein: An Outdoor Art-Making Event

column2: Sensual Tantra - a somatic approach to intimacy
column7: The Center SF- 548 Fillmore St @ Oak in SF
column8: Looking to deepen your connection with yourself and others? Sensual Tantra is a down-to-earth, playful workshop that blends somatic (body) awareness with the ancient practices of Tantra to help you experience intimacy in a whole new way! Perfect for singles to meet like-minded singles and for couples to deepen their connection with each other, this workshop is all about getting out of your head and into your body‚Äîno fluff, just real tools to enhance your relationships and your personal sense of connection.

column2: Get Out of Your Head in Bed
column8: Do you find yourself performing sex instead of experiencing it? Do you get stuck in your head worrying about your appearance, performance, orgasm, or just your overwhelming to-do list? Anxious thoughts make it difficult if not impossible to experience pleasure and are often at the root of many sexual problems, including erectile dysfunction and anorgasmia.

There is a growing wave of union organizing in factories in Mexico. Workers are organizing unions of their own choosing, independent of corporate influence. They are throwing out phony unions and their contracts that only protect factory owners and do not benefit workers. They are demanding wage raises, an end to sexual harassment and respect for their workplace rights. Presentations by Julia Qui√±onez, director, Comit√© Fronterizo de Obreras (Border Workers Committee) Mira Rubio, coordinator, California Trade Justice Coalition Poetry by Rafael Jes√∫s Gonz√°lez Music by Elizabeth Esteva This is a benefit to help worker centers and independent unions in Mexico and the campaign for stronger worker protections in trade agreements. Donate at https://www.livingwage-sf.org/online-donation-form/ or bid in an online art auction at https://www.livingwage-sf.org/auction/

column2: What are the root causes of forced migration?
column8: Free admission - Everyone is welcome! Discussion panel: What are the root causes of forced migration? Trump attempted to cancel TPS during his first term and is revoking it for Haitians. Join us in discussion for a call to action to save TPS. Come to recognize the 44th anniversary of the assassination of Saint Oscar Romero, a seminal event which plunged the country of El Salvador into a civil war. A mass movement in the U.S to protect refugees from this civil war gave rise to sanctuary cities and the precursor program to the Temporary Protected Status program (TPS). The legacy of U.S. military intervention and ongoing U.S-imposed neo-liberal economic policies have contributed to Salvadorans, Hondurans, Haitians and migrants from other nations being TPS holders.

Somatic Breathwork combines ancient wisdom with modern physiology to regulate your nervous system. We'll utilize breathing techniques to discharge stress, unprocessed emotions, trauma, & limiting beliefs. This creates the space to repattern your nervous system & access elevated emotions of deep peace, gratitude, love and purpose. We'll also breathe to strengthen heart coherence; the synchronization & communication between heart, mind & nervous system. The combination of these powerful practices will reset, recharge, and uplevel your mind, body & spirit.

column2: "Cosmic Hiccups and the Crocodile Below" by Blake Sugarman
column7: The Marsh Theater at 1062 Valencia St, San Francisco, CA 94110
column8: In his latest bit of¬†"stand-up existentialism stumbling through the looking glass," Blake explores how his dad's magic tricks shaped his view of reality, the fundamental ambiguity of existence, blockage/breakthrough, and the power of placebo. Sure, he sweeps a few things under the rug, but that's between him and the floorboards. Never mind that crocodile-shaped lump over there...  The piece is 20 minutes and will be presented with a couple short works by Amy Blondell and Zoe Kat as part of "Monday Night Marsh." Tickets and info at the link below. Blake Sugarman is an interdisciplinary artist whose¬†work has been described as ‚Äúspoken word and installation art in a theatrical duet.‚Äù Past solo¬†shows¬†have been presented by La MaMa, The Brick (Resident Artist Series), The Marsh, The Bitter End, The Living Gallery, and NYU's Experimental Theatre Wing. Learn more at blakesugarman.com¬†

column2: Shaping San Francisco Public Talk: Lessons for the Biosphere
column8: In our seat upon the California Coast, we who live in the territory of Yelamu are favored with remarkable biodiversity. A conversation between Bruce Byers, ecologist and author of the new book, Nature on the Edge: Lessons for the Biosphere from the California Coast, and Sara Moncada, the Association of Ramaytush Ohlone Director of Native Ecology, looks at the uniqueness of place and locates us within it. From our state rock‚ÄîSerpentine‚Äîto local events like the annual circumambulation of Mt. Tamalpais and the restored salmon habitat in Muir Woods to the concept of bioregionalism that began with Peter Berg and Planet Drum, join us for an exploration of the biosphere and the knowledge we gain from it.

The Indian Classical Sessions are an informal gathering dedicated to sharing the meditative beauty, ecstatic energy, and sheer majesty of South Asian music. Hosted by percussionist, drumset and tabla player Sameer Gupta this gathering focuses on curating 4 short live sets that represent different influences and traditions surrounding South Asian music. Our goal is to connect, build our raga music loving community, and share South Asian classical music in an impromptu, casual and attentive setting.

column2: SF Housing Week - How did we get here? A History of Housing Policy in SF
column8: San Francisco has been mandated to have a credible plan to build 82,000 units by 2032 - but only built about 1,200 new units in 2024. What led us to this point, and what does it mean for the future of the city? How did the city of free love become the city of expensive housing, and where does our future take us? This session will kick off our week-long series with critical context, history, and discussion of the big-picture strategies which might lead us towards more equitable and affordable housing in the city. Join award-winning author and New York Times Journalist Conor Dougherty in covering the background and key context for the rest of our housing discussion

column2: SF Housing Week - Affordable Housing 101: What is it?
column8: Did you know that SF has not only ‚ÄúAffordable Housing‚Äù programs for recently homeless residents, but also ‚ÄúAffordable Housing‚Äù programs for households earning up to nearly $200,000/year? If you‚Äôve also heard that it costs nearly $800,000 to build an affordable unit, come hear from a city administrator and an affordable housing developer how we make new housing projects come together to get more units built!

column2: SF Housing Week - The Future of SF Housing - a New Zoning Map
column8: The clock is ticking: San Francisco must adopt a new zoning map by January 2026, or lose its zoning control to the state. What‚Äôs a zoning map, you ask? The new zoning map determines the maximum size of buildings which can be built- and thus it‚Äôs at the center of contentious negotiations over the future of the city. After two years of work, SF Planning has a brand-spanking-new proposal that they hope will be the final version of the map, and they are seeking feedback from citizens like you!

column2: Com¬£‚ô° (compound love), Thomas Carnacki, Thomas Dimuzio, W.O.E.
column7: Peacock Lounge, 552 Haight Street, SF, CA
column8: Com¬£‚ô° (compound love): Returning from Japan to San Francisco, where in the 1990s he ran the Drum Machine Museum, Whitebox VIP, and created the "Drum Machine TV" channel on SF Public Access, Mickey Tachibana creates layered, immersive experiences by integrating modular synthesis, ethnic instruments, and field recordings into their audio-visual performances. Don't miss this rare occasion to welcome back San Francisco's prodigal curator, performer, and mystic. https://artscouncil-kanazawa.jp/artists/3795 | https://www.instagram.com/soundscape_kanazawa ‚Üµ Thomas Carnacki: Ghosts, like people in fiction, work through a presence outside of time that bears upon the living with potency more enduring than those considered "alive" in the routine sense. The eponymous detective ghost-finder and occultist might have vanished in 1912 or... may yet stir in the limbs of Gregory Scharpen, Cheryl Leonard, Sheila Bosco, et alia. Is it so hard to believe Carnacki's "Electric Pentacle" or the Saaamaaa Ritual could be transposed to sound synthesizer or contact microphones. Wouldn't you be compelled to witness these sonic implements "creaking in a mad vile glee" ritualistically employed inside the Whistling Room...er, the Peacock Lounge? Get a front row seat, a garlic in each ear, then hold hands to form a circle, well... if you dare. https://thomascarnacki.bandcamp.com ‚Üµ Thomas Dimuzio: Dimuzio is the wizard the land of Oz wished for, boundless, benemalevolent, shrouded in torrents of sound, daring lions to speak and machines to weep. Come set your straw brains alight and melt your metal heart while your furry ears purr and yowl. Innovative techniques of sound synthesis, signal processing, algorithmic mixing and custom crossfade looping fuel this synergy of man and machine. https://gench.com/thomas-dimuzio ‚Üµ W.O.E.: Blending minimal techno, IDM, and noise, W.O.E. absorbs and reflects the shredded energies of our times via live performance. Members JaMile Jackson and Brian Tester have long histories in the Bay Area's electronic and underground rock scenes and combine well-honed improvisational skills with underlying structures to explore connections and experiences through sound. Their aresenal combines portable digital technologies with modern analog instrumentation. https://glowingdagger.com/woe

column7: 2400 Bayshore Blvd  San Francisco, CA 94134, USA
column8: Are we just the result of a chaotic collision of cells, or has our journey already begun before we take our first breath?  The Fetus Show is an absurd, comedic exploration of birth, our baggage, and the grand cosmic joke of the interwovenness of it all. From conception, to the womb, to our  coming to the world, Jessica Farber invites audiences to examine the substance of what we inherit, what we carry, what we find and what we inevitably lose and leave behind. A surreal, irreverent take on the so-called ‚Äúmiracle of life,‚Äù this show dives headfirst into nature vs. nurture, destiny vs. chaos, and the eternal question - what is the meaning of it all?

Here's why you won't want to miss this event: Artistic Diversity: Explore three floors of studios, including painting, drawing, photography, sculpture, ceramics, fiber-art, fabric design, collage, letterpress, and more! Supporting Culture: Immerse yourself in the arts culture of San Francisco, where your presence fuels the passion of local artists, creating a sense of connection and pride in the city's vibrant artistic landscape. Easy Access: Our location is a breeze to reach via MUNI, ride-sharing, and offers ample street parking. 1890 Bryant Street Studios is also wheelchair accessible, ensuring a welcoming environment for everyone.Take Home a Treasure: Discover a wide range of artwork that caters to every taste and budget, ensuring that art enthusiasts of all walks can take home a piece they love.Energize your soul, ignite your creativity, and immerse yourself in the wonder of art at 1890 Bryant Street Studios' Spring Open Studios.

column2: Shostakovich 5: A Bold Act of Defiance Against Fascism!
column7: Palace of Fine Arts - 3601 Lyon Street, San Francisco
column8: This spring, join the Golden Gate Symphony Orchestra & Chorus to explore the power of MUSIC AND HISTORY. Dmitri Shostakovich‚Äôs Symphony No. 5.   Premiered in 1937 during the height of Stalin‚Äôs Great Purge, this work was Shostakovich‚Äôs carefully crafted response to official criticism, walking a fine line between state appeasement and artistic defiance. While publicly praised as ‚ÄúA Soviet Artist‚Äôs Reply to Criticism,‚Äù its sweeping melodies and searing intensity suggest a deeper, more personal cry against oppression. Each note of this masterpiece challenges the silence imposed by oppression and the enduring power of creativity as resistance. Shostakovich 5 is more than music‚Äîit‚Äôs a rallying cry for freedom, inspiring listeners to reclaim their agency in the face of control. But the journey doesn‚Äôt end there! Immerse yourself in the evocative beauty of Russian choral masterpieces by Rachmaninov, Rimsky-Korsakov, and Tchaikovsky.  A soaring tribute to what‚Äôs possible when community makes art together.

A Stone Cold Read is a reading of a play where the script is chosen at random by the audience from a hat and immediately cast by pulling names from the same hat. Then our ensemble of actors jumps in for a fresh, lively, and often hilarious reading, where roles are cast randomly, often wildly against type, age, and gender. Enjoy all the fun and immediacy of live improv, but with strong well-crafted scripts. Come join us as we pull out all the stops and create spontaneous theater magic.

column2: Cosmic Hiccups and the Crocodile Below

column8: In his latest bit of "stand-up existentialism stumbling through the looking glass," Blake explores how his dad's magic tricks shaped his view of reality, the fundamental ambiguity of existence, blockage/breakthrough, and the power of placebo. column2: Couples Retreat - Sustainable Intimacy: Reignite the Flame for the Long Game
column8: Do you and your partner miss that old feeling of excitement and passion that has faded into complacency and predictability? Struggling with different libidos, relating to sex like it‚Äôs a chore, and feeling rejection and resentment are just some of the challenges couples in long-term relationships face. When intimacy gets stagnant it can be hard to find ways to reconnect sexually that feel genuine and pleasurable.  Escape the distractions of daily life and immerse yourselves in a transformative 3-night, 4-day retreat designed to reignite passion, rebuild intimacy, and create a sustainable foundation for lasting connection.This safe and supportive environment will allow you to unearth the specific challenges and beliefs that have hindered your intimacy and learn tailor-made strategies to overcome them. Through carefully curated activities, exercises, and discussions, they‚Äôll guide you on a sensual journey to reignite desire, explore new pleasures, and rejuvenate your romantic connection.

Get ready for Camp Orientation at Camp KinZ‚Äîa summer camp that has been through more than its fair share of ups, downs, and bear-related lawsuits. Director Randy (Kendra Ferguson) is hanging on by a thread, trying to keep his beloved camp afloat after financial collapse and the messy fallout from last year's incidents. Enter Counselor Juicykinz (Juice Ried), a well-meaning (but totally unpredictable) trust-fund bro who is trying to save the camp in the only way he knows‚Äîby embracing complete and utter chaos. Don‚Äôt miss this roller skating clown duo at Camp KinZ where Juicykinz‚Äôs antics, paired with Randy‚Äôs dad-like energy and increasing stress, lead to an unforgettable orientation. Get ready to show off those survival skills, sing your heart out around the campfire, and remember: ABSOLUTELY NO FOOD FIGHTS THIS YEAR. Pack your knapsacks and gear up for this year‚Äôs Camp Orientation! Don‚Äôt forget to bring your fanny packs, single-ply toilet paper, and your spirit of adventure. Extra community service hours awarded to those who dress up ready for camp!

column2: ‚ÄúLost & Found‚Äù Eric Kupers‚Äô Inclusive Theatre Workshop
column8: ‚ÄúLost & Found‚Äù is an Inclusive Performance work about the losses since the pandemic and visions of emerging futures that can arise from the wreckage. Presented as part of this year‚Äôs San Francisco International Arts Festival, this project is welcoming performers of all ages, sizes, shapes, abilities/disabilities, ancestries, artistic backgrounds, experience levels, and body identities to join in as a "community chorus" in the performances at El Rio on Wednesday April 30th and Monkey Brains on Thursday May 8th. Held in Bethany Center‚Äôs beautiful Community Room, graciously donated by Ruth‚Äôs Table, this workshop will introduce interested community members to Wandering Ensemble's open approaches to movement, sound-making, story-telling, and group improvisation. Participants can then choose to join the ensemble for one or more of the performances if they'd like. Following the workshop, join 60 Bay Area AANHPI artists for the ROOTED exhibition reception at Ruth‚Äôs Table (next door; 3160 21st Street); this event will feature many exhibiting artists live on-site, complimentary noodle bowls from Saucy Asian, live music by Rozhit, and special remarks from the exhibition‚Äôs guest curator, artist Jun Yang.

Join us for a special evening of connection, creativity, and community as we celebrate ROOTED, an exhibition featuring over 50 Bay Area-based Asian American, Native Hawaiian, and Pacific Islander (AANHPI) artists. Presented on the cusp of AANHPI Heritage Month and in a time when voices of migrants are being silenced and the values of diversity and inclusion are under attack, ROOTED stands as a bold and necessary testament to collective resilience.

Are you overwhelmed and overcommitted? Does something you do to decompress ultimately cause you more stress in the long run? This solutions-focused, totally non-woo intro workshop gives you a quick overview of the human stress response, the difference between stress and stressors (and the practical reasons it matters), a framework to make more skillful choices around your overwhelm and set yourself up for success, and an activity you can do to start building resilience to stress now so over time you can bounce back better! Includes a personalization worksheet to do in the workshop to support you in actually making the change you want to see (not just making a resolution).

column2: Bending Shapes: a guided improv dance meditation
column8: {first class is free - chargeless trial experience for all first time arrivers.} Learn to become a movist with ice composer, vocalist, retired ballerina, bending shape dancer, serrulate sonancer and ice opera designer, Xxhe. The first low-light class of the month -- we will, through dance meditation, isolate different parts of our body and mentally train ourselves to focus on each of them alone while moving. Along with learning the basics of dance, you will be given a handful of set movements to keep in your improv vocabulary and encouraged to pull them out throughout the dance. Though dancing is a muscle-demanding art, it is also a mental art. Learn not just how to move like a movist but how to think like one. At the highest level of Xxhe's improv style you will be an expert at making hard edged shapes with your body, ungulating your arms and torso in wind-like patterns, spinning open armed in controlled motions, and using your head as a momentous tool. For all levels, this class will also cover warmups, short exercise techniques and dance basics.

column2: Flow and Flourish: Dual Wielding for Impact Play with Mx Mayhem Mai
column8: Two is better than one! Mayhem is known for their dual wielding, ambidextrous impact style, and in this class they teach how to throw double floggers, canes, paddles, and more! Come learn the basics of throwing matched pairs of impact toys, using both hands, at the same time, and how to alternate from hand to hand. Attendees will have time to practice and get feedback from Mayhem during supervised lab time. The space will be open for practice or play until 11 pm. Note: Dual wielding is not the same as Florentine flogging (which Mayhem can teach by request). This class will not focus on Florentine flogging. Type of Class: Demo + lab time Skill Level: All levels Prerequisites: Ability to throw an impact toy one handed, plus ability to practice throwing a pair of toys with both hands. Materials needed: Two impact toys of the same type and size (ex: floggers, canes, paddles). No toys? Bring your hands! Leather gloves are recommended. Partners are encouraged for hands on practice during the demo but singles are welcome. Instructor bio: Mx Mayhem Mai (they/them) is a queer, nonbinary pro-dom and educator from San Francisco. Known for their ambidextrous play style, Mayhem teaches a wide variety of kink topics, from beginner level games, to ergonomics of impact play to mitigate repetitive stress injury. Learn more at https://allmylinks.com/mxmayhemmai Location: Workshop will be held at The Kink Store in SF. Practice what you learn in this great space filled with classic and innovative dungeon furniture and toys that will be available for use during the lab time after the workshop.

David DeRuiter is back onstage with his debut solo show A Shy Politician ‚Äî a physical comedy about an idiot who can‚Äôt stop running for office.  Strap in for 45 minutes of political gaffes as our unlikely hero stumbles headlong into a political candidacy. It‚Äôs the day of the city council election, and Ben Porch is throwing his hat in the ring. There‚Äôs just one problem: he‚Äôs too shy to speak. Determined to win some votes, he makes his case in other ways: a spiffy wardrobe, a radio ad, a solo debate, and free lollipops. The more attention Ben gets, the more he likes the idea of holding public office. But does he have what it takes to get elected? Does he even want to? The blend of narrative comedy, classic clowning, rowdy audience interaction, and broad slapstick farce results in a one-of-a-kind show that is at once funny, stupid, and moving.David‚Äôs recent stage work includes the Edinburgh Fringe run of Crap Ballet, which previewed at the Yale School of Drama, as well as The Tank & Caveat in New York.

column2: Digital Security in an Increasingly Hostile World
column7: Gray Area / Grand Theater 2665 Mission St, San Francisco, CA 94110
column8: This Digital Security training is an introductory workshop designed to help individuals understand the fundamentals of online safety and cybersecurity. The training covers key topics such as recognizing phishing attempts, creating strong passwords, securing devices and accounts, using multi-factor authentication, and protecting personal and professional data. Participants will learn practical tools and techniques to safeguard themselves from common cyber threats, empowering them to navigate the digital landscape with greater confidence and resilience. This session is ideal for beginners and anyone looking to strengthen their foundational knowledge of digital security.

Rooted in the tradition of theatrical clowning and devised performance, ‚ÄúNone of Your Business‚Äù is an intimate, genre-defying work that blends physical comedy, vulnerability, and stream-of-consciousness. This solo clown show is about a guy who's spent the last 10 years inside watching TV. Tonight, he emerges from his room only to stumble upon one of the most haunting experiences known to man: being in a room full of strangers at a party. Playfully dissecting social etiquette and internal monologue‚Äîrevealing the absurdity, beauty, and contradictions of ‚Äúbeing yourself‚Äù and maintaining privacy while in public. Will you join us for the party?
