column2: Intro to Animal Play w/ Psychokitty
column8: Curious about animal role play? Ready to unleash your wild side? Join us for an engaging exploration of animal role play, where we will dive into behaviors, equipment, and toys that bring this dynamic form of expression to life. We will also discuss different levels of involvement and the various reasons people are drawn to this type of play. You will even have the chance to try out some animal play yourself! The workshop runs from 7 to 9 PM, with the space remaining open for you to continue experimenting and playing until 11 PM. It is great for singles, couples, or groups, and everyone is welcome.

A 3-day gathering. Lighting the Edge is an experimental gathering that has been growing over the last ~3 years. Each time, with the help of those who are curious enough to step in, the community lands a little more, the ethos deepens, and we continue to break open ways that we are ‚Äúsupposed‚Äù to gather. Together, we co-create, hold space and witness something which seems to emerge amongst us: a group field which has a collective desire and intention but is created from truth which rings through each individual. This may be the most unique festival you have ever been to because what it is will be created by those who show up. We ebb between collective group field and intimate facilitated workshops like the expansion and contraction of the lungs of a living breathing organism. We listen to what is needed amongst the group and invite those willing and capable to take that space, offering your service to the community. You will have time to enjoy and experience new ways of expressing and connecting as well as be encouraged and supported to facilitate and hold space for your favorite ways to do just that. A festival everyone loves is possible because you will be creating it based on what it is you desire at the moment. And so will everyone else.

column2: Resonance: A Music Journey Through Sound & Vibration (5/30)
column7: Yoga Flow SF - Ocean - 385 Ashton Avenue San Francisco, CA 94112
column8: Join us for Resonance, an immersive, full-body listening experience that invites you to slow down, tune in, and journey inward through music and vibration. This guided journey is a first-of-its-kind collaboration, combining Zendo Stereo methodology with Crescendo Research‚Äôs groundbreaking tactile audio technology for a collective journey through music. Experience the music through a Crescendo tactile floor, a room-sized somatic speaker that envelops your whole body with powerful vibration. Feel the deep resonance of the music through your body, not just your ears, enhancing the emotional impact of every note. You‚Äôll be guided through Zendo Stereo, a deep listening ritual that blends thoughtfully curated music with simple yet powerful practices designed to down-regulate the nervous system, open space for inner reflection, and reconnect you with your deeper self. The experience: A deep listening ritual pairing thoughtfully curated music through headphones with somatic practices designed to down-regulate the nervous system, open the heart, and awaken deeper reflection and connection. Each session is limited to 30 participants to preserve intimacy and depth.

column2: Artifact: Pantheon One - 360 Live AV Laser Set
column8: ARTIFACT invites you to PANTHEON ONE ‚Äî a gathering where light becomes ritual and sound becomes ceremony. The stage? A six-column altar pulsing with light, rhythm, and bass. And floating at its center: a larger-than-life, laser-powered Artifact waiting to be activated. The first Artifact to awaken, Pantheon One is a modern-day echo of the ancient Roman Pantheon, a temple built to honor higher powers and unite all people beneath a shared dome.

HOLE is an experimental theater piece by Amy Langer and Bahaar Taj in collaboration with the San Francisco Neo-Futurists. Set at the beach, HOLE revolves around the act of literally digging a large hole in the ground‚Äîa simple yet profound action that symbolizes human obsession, compulsion, and perseverance. A play without a fourth wall (or, in fact, any walls), HOLE asks the audience: What needs to be done for you to take up the shovel?

column2: Crosstown 2.0: Candlestick Point to Forest Hill

column2: Book Binding Sip N Craft Burlingame
column8: Hey Friends, come join us at Leland Tea + Wine for an evening of crafting! Walk away with new friends+ beautiful hand stitched journals! This will be a "white belt" class that builds every month into new skills. We will be getting acquainted with tools, stitches, and creative and accessible embellishment techniques! This is class 2, but anyone coming for the first time will be instructed to tackle lesson 1! There is a Sliding Scale option on 2 "helper" tickets because we'd like everyone to be able to attend, and the general admission is $50 to cover materials/instruction. 2 item minimum required, so buy a glass of fine wine by La Sirena (the award winning boutique winery we'll be featuring for the month of May at Leland Tea), a cheeseplate or just a pot of tea and scones! Wear comfy clothing and bring layers! Feel free to bring your favorite vinyl albums. We'll have a little record player so we can share the old fashioned experience of listening to albums together while we sip and craft! Perfect for a date night too! Metered Parking and Parking Lot directly across the street. Parking meters end at 6pm, so no biggie!

Maryam‚Äôs artwork explores cultural identity, memory, and the immigrant experience, currently addressing the concept of ‚Äòhome‚Äô, and how fragile, ephemeral and hard-to-find that might be. Maryam‚Äôs childhood was deeply impacted by the Iran-Iraq war, having to flee their home in Tehran on several occasions, in the face of enemy missile attacks. As a teenager her family immigrated to Canada, hoping for a more stable life. Now, decades later, Maryam realizes growing deep roots has been a constant challenge in her life. Her never-ending-search for ‚Äòhome‚Äô is the topic of her recent artwork, which serves as a visual autobiography, tracing her personal journey from Iran, to Canada, UK and the US.

column2: WASTELAND: The Most Ultimate and Final Showdown

column8: Wasteland: The Most Ultimate and Final Showdown is a Clown Theatre satire colliding the poetry of T.S. Eliot with the spiritual and cultural collapse of our times. Part dark physical comedy, part apocalyptic B-movie farce, it follows the last free-thinking clowns on earth‚Äîhunted by the authoritarian Mime regime in a world where laughter is rebellion and chaos is sacred. At the end of civilization, all you can do is put on your red nose, load your squirt gun, and perform one last pratfall into oblivion.

‚ÄúForgetting.‚Äù An Archive of 80 drawings, 2011-2023. It‚Äôs about loss of control. Letting the unreal fade so the real remains, sacred desecration, a rupturing of image/symbol and linearity leading to sublime failure. The oily dreaming called ‚Äòdivinity‚Äô has slipped between my 80 profane limbs, contours crushed with a feather (a paintbrush carved by hand and made of my own hair babbling inscriptions ‚Äî ‚Äògrapholalia‚Äô: language that exceeds language, broken overflowing, leaves behind a grasping murmur, intangibility between god (i forgot how to spell)) gasp. Impurity contest: put all your cards on the table with me. I‚Äôll give you a free reading! üåà

column2: Chapel of the Chimes Garden of Memory
column7: Chapel Of The Chimes Oakland Funeral Home & Crematory
column8: Garden of Memory offers a unique and personal musical experience to every listener as they rove freely through this Oakland Historic Landmark building. Our co-sponsor, Chapel of the Chimes, is the largest above-ground cemetery (mausoleum which is an inside cemetery) west of the Mississippi. Chimes started out as a street car station that was transformed into the California Memorial Crematorium and Columbarium in 1909. The property was expanded and transformed initially by Julia Morgan and later by Aaron Green, a prot√©g√© of Frank Lloyd Wright. The Oakland Historical Landmark today continues to provide complete end-of-life services, part of a family of four premier Bay Area cemeteries, columbariums, crematories, mausoleums and funeral homes. From traditional to personalized, Chapel of the Chimes assists the diverse families of Northern California to fully memorialize and celebrate a life lived.

The Creative Code Intensive is a foundational program for artists, designers, and technologists looking to expand their practice through media literacy, computational art, and experiential design. Returning from a multi-year hiatus, this year Gray Area has hosted 16 participants in the program who will be exhibiting their work. Participants have created work spanning interactive installations, educational experiences, and audiovisual immersion. Collectively, their works examine themes of belonging, personal history, and cultural identity in a time where technology mediates social interaction and communication.

At Decentered Arts, we want to use technology wherever possible to make sourcing and hosting interesting events seamless. We're excited to share that our events tracker is now powered by AI! Historically, our team would source and painstakingly copy details from event flyers across the internet manually into our tracker. We're using the latest computer vision models to read event flyers and automagically add to our tracker; so our team can double down on sourcing and hosting! In the spirit of community, our code is open source so anybody can adapt it for their needs! https://github.com/faizan-ali/decentered-events-tracker Built by https://x.com/faizanali94, an SF resident for the past 8 years who's forever bullish on the city. We still encourage submissions.

Center yourself with a Vinyasa shake-off of death, loss, & disappointment and flow into an Ecstatic Birth of the Summer Solstice and New Moon! We're excited to bring you an 80s themed experiment: Ecstatic Yoga, a playful free-flowing non-judgmental combination of Old + New. As we mourn the loss of so much in our communities, we manifest sadness as fertilizer to blossom sweet sweat of new creations, novel experiences, next-era-of-life communities in fresh spaces. Come learn what ECSTATIC YOGA is all about!

We're having another Serrulate Sonance Ecstatic Dance. We tested out this show in NYC and things got so delightfully moving that there were people rolling on the floor dancing their eyes out. column2: Double Cross Nature Treasure Hunt, Section 3
column8: Section 3 of a slow-paced stroll on the Double Cross Trail over three days. We‚Äôll explore nature habitats, identify plants and critters, and take in San Francisco‚Äôs hills and water. Join one, two or all three walks. Each day we‚Äôll cover about 5 miles on trails and sidewalks, up and down hills with 600-700 feet total elevation gain. Bring layers, water, and snacks or lunch. Restrooms / Porta Loos should be available at start and finish but may be limited in between. Optional no-host, end-of-walk refreshments at nearby watering hole. Co-sponsored by Nature in the City.

Celebrate some of the highlights of a great urban trail - easy transit connections, and terrific refreshments along the way! Meet along the Double Cross at old school favorite Tommy's Joynt, 1101 Geary at Van Ness. Bring your money (cash is king here) for a beverage and late lunch/early dinner, perhaps roast beef or turkey, carved to order. We‚Äôll have about 45 minutes before heading out on trail, with one or two stops along the way before our Pier 23 finish (great food and drink here too), about 3 miles in all. The F Market streetcar stops across the street from Pier 23, or take the short walk to the Ferry Building or Embarcadero BART. 21 and over only.

column2: Intro to Intuitive Painting Community Class: Tending the Creative Fire
column8: üé® Come play with paint! Discover a world where colors and brushes guide you into the depths of your soul. Our intuitive painting classes are a journey of self-discovery and expression. Ready to explore? Space is limited. Reserve your spot now! ‚ú® üßëüèΩ‚Äçüé® In intuitive painting, there is a lot of permission to explore and create. This is not a typical ‚Äòart‚Äô class in which you will learn techniques and methods of painting; instead you will be expertly guided to tap in and listen to your intuition and paint from your heart. We learn to pay attention to our own intuitive voice that is free from beliefs and concepts. In this way paintings happen spontaneously, unplanned and unexpected!

column2: NO I.C.E. Fundraiser and Workshop: How We Build A Culture Of Care
column7: The Faight Collective, 473A Haight St, San Francisco
column8: This event is a Fundraiser for those who are at risk of being detained/ kidnapped/ deported by ICE. The $ raised from this event will go towards buying out local vendors (tamale/ elote/ taco/ fruit stands) so they can still pay their bills and support their families while staying off the street. This food will be distributed throughout the community for free, especially for those who cannot work during this time or cannot leave their homes.  This event is also a workshop discussing how strong, long lasting communities are built. We will not only discuss how to start a community, but how to maintain a healthy community long term. This will be an open community conversation and will be Live Streamed on Instagram @snipping.thorns for all who want to watch the workshop.
column9: $40 tickets, but will also be live streamed on IG for free. Splitting tickets is encouraged. For example, 4 friends can chip in $10 each. 1 of those friends can attend in person and the other 3 can watch the Live Stream. This event is all about community care.

At Decentered Arts, we want to use technology wherever possible to make sourcing and hosting interesting events seamless. We're excited to share that our events tracker is now powered by AI! Historically, our team would source and painstakingly copy details from event flyers across the internet manually into our tracker. We're using the latest computer vision models to read event flyers and automagically add to our tracker; so our team can double down on sourcing and hosting! In the spirit of community, our code is open source so anybody can adapt it for their needs! https://github.com/faizan-ali/decentered-events-tracker Built by https://x.com/faizanali94, an SF resident for the past 8 years who's forever bullish on the city. We still encourage submissions.

column2: Hello, My Name Is Eluterio : A GALLER EXPERIENCE (Opening)
column7: The Faight Collective 475 Haight St San Francisco, CA 94117
column8: This show is an intimate, introspective look at Eluterio‚Äôs journey through a year as a full-time artist‚Äîwhat they‚Äôve learned, what they‚Äôve had to unlearn, and how creating has helped them rebuild their identity from the inside out. Each piece is a chapter in the story of choosing self over fear, and the quiet power in staying true to your voice even when the world feels loud From The Artist: After much reflection, I‚Äôve made the decision to leave San Francisco, a city that has held my heart, my growth, and my dreams these last few years. My upcoming gallery show Hello will also be my goodbye, a love letter to the community that shaped me, challenged me, and believed in me. Living here was once a distant dream, and now it feels like a completed destiny. This city gave me the space to begin a journey I‚Äôve waited my whole life to start, and for the past 3 years, I‚Äôve been chasing that dream with everything I have. Now it‚Äôs time to keep going. Thank you, San Francisco.

column7: Peacock Lounge, 552 Haight St, SF, CA
column8: Antimatter What is the voltage of static electricity that courses over your skin standing each of five million hairs straight on end? Can the answer be derived quantitatively from the waveforms cascading against malleus, anvil and stapes to trigger follicle surge? Or is math itself lost in the abstraction to qualitative, perceptual, and metaphysical sense? Such shortcuts to madness are best explored through the complexities of minimal materialism, particles of sound as sculpted by Antimatter, the solo project of Xopher Davidson. https://soundcloud.com/antiphonic-1

column8: Hooray for play in the face of uncertainty! Improvisational principles, concepts, and games give us THE VERY TOOLS we need to navigate the next chaotic, unplanned, or uncertain moment - on or off stage. This 3-hour workshop is intended for clowns, laypeople, actors, improvisers, curious humans and everyone and anyone else. You‚Äôll learn (or revisit) the fundamental principles of improvisation - including spontaneity, listening, storytelling, and failing cheerfully. You‚Äôll play games, do exercises, get some shared knowledge and get a sense of skills and tools that will be explored more deeply in a longer class series. This is a low pressure, low stakes class - being funny is not a prerequisite! Performance experience is not necessary! If you‚Äôve been curious about what the heck improv is or want to dip your proverbial toes in the improv pool, this is the class for you. Rebecca Poretsky has been improvising for over 20 years.  She was a company member and coach with the acclaimed BATS Improv for 10+ years, has taught improv at USF, performed with Crisis Hopkins, Un-Scripted Theater Co, and Awkward Dinner Party in SF and trained at BATS and at the Annoyance Theater in Chicago. Rebecca has trained in acting and clown at Shakespeare and Company in Lenox, MA and red nose clown with Giovanni Fusetti in Boulder. She‚Äôs developed and performed numerous solo performance pieces and co-created and participated in numerous original ensemble pieces. You can also find her in a bizarre number of semi-viral cat-themed videos online. She specializes in embodied, character, and narrative-driven scene work and improvisation. She loves helping people get out of their heads and into their bodies and remember that they know how to play. rebeccaporetsky.com

This intensive will explore the idiotic work of the BUFFOON. Ugly, ridiculous and provocative, buffoons create a surreal world of clashes and shocks that transform to moments of pathos. Wilcox‚Äôs method, developed in San Francisco streets and performance spaces, revolves around three core ideas; a world turned upside down, a movement towards the grotesque, and derisive mockery. We will attack these ideas through exercises and group improvisations. Bring knee pads, a broken musical instrument or noisemaker, and your willingness to humiliate yourself in front of others. Eric Wilcox is a performance artist based in San Francisco. As a mime actor, Eric played countless wordless shows in schools and theaters around the world. In San Francisco with the street buffoon gang, SF Buffoons, Eric gleefully insulted thousands and created unique hybrid performances. In Germany he co-produced the MIME>BERLIN festival and summer mime intensive. His themes include; identity, memory, time, desire, and how to deprogram the body.  He is keenly aware of the power of theater to dissolve social boundaries and bring people together.

At Decentered Arts, we want to use technology wherever possible to make sourcing and hosting interesting events seamless. We're excited to share that our events tracker is now powered by AI! Historically, our team would source and painstakingly copy details from event flyers across the internet manually into our tracker. We're using the latest computer vision models to read event flyers and automagically add to our tracker; so our team can double down on sourcing and hosting! In the spirit of community, our code is open source so anybody can adapt it for their needs! https://github.com/faizan-ali/decentered-events-tracker Built by https://x.com/faizanali94, an SF resident for the past 8 years who's forever bullish on the city. column8: Thursdays at the Gregangelo Museum are our collaborative studio days and the only weekly event personally hosted by Gregangelo himself. Join us for a truly one-of-a-kind experience that begins with live music, a guest luminary in a brief, interactive presentation than a homemade lunch shared among artists and guests.  A collective of fascinating local and international artists gathers each week to create the art, stories, costumes, and performances for upcoming shows and installations. After lunch, you‚Äôll be invited on a behind-the-scenes tour of the museum and art studios, where you‚Äôll witness live art-making in progress and uncover the secret stories of the Gregangelo Museum. For decades, this has been a private, artist-only gathering. Now, for the first time, we‚Äôre offering you a rare backstage pass to join our exclusive lunchtime mixer. Tickets are limited for this special edition impromptu experience. Come shine with us and step inside a living painting where everyone adds their own color to the scene.

column8: Only three time slots are available between 1 pm and 6 pm. One at 1pm, 3pm, and 5pm ‚ÄúFeed your head‚Äù on a psychedelic odyssey inside ‚Äúthe city‚Äôs last bastion of weird art‚Äù (SFGate). Logic and proportion fall away as you‚Äôre transported through a labyrinth of nine unique installations, each one curiouser and curiouser than the next. Alice in Wonderland, 1001 Arabian Nights, ancient myths and Dr. Seuss collide on this globetrotting, time-traveling journey of self discovery. Part residence, part artist collective, part ‚Äúconnectatorium,‚Äù the Gregangelo Museum remains world-renowned as one of the top destinations in the city for all who seek an authentic, intimate, and inspiring San Francisco experience unlike any other. Are you ready to look inside?

column8: Step into the power of the ensemble. In this dynamic, immersive intensive led by acclaimed theater artist Dan Griffiths, participants will explore the visceral, embodied practice of moving, listening, and creating as one. Drawing from the ancient engine of theater‚Äîthe interplay between chorus, hero, and muses‚Äîwe will investigate how story emerges through collective breath, image, and impulse. What does it mean to hold the space as the many, while uplifting the one? To channel inspiration as both vessel and voice? Through this mythic framework, we will train the ensemble to function as a living organism: responsive, intuitive, and alive to rhythm, design, and each other. Through structured improvisation, physical storytelling, and deep attention to musicality, tempo, line, and architecture, we‚Äôll learn to share our center‚Äîto partner not only with fellow performers, but with props, structures, and the unseen forces that shape story. This is a space for conjuring. For ensemble-driven magic. For surrendering individual ego in favor of collaborative impulse. Whether you‚Äôre a performer, director, or deviser, this intensive will challenge and refine your ability to generate dynamic, image-rich theater rooted in presence, myth, and shared vision. Come ready to move. Come ready to play. Come ready to invoke the muses and awaken the hero‚Äôs path through the voice of the chorus.

column2: Naga and the Captainess Grand Lighting Ceremony at Golden Gate Park
column7: Rainbow Falls Pond, Golden Gate Park -- JFK Promenade btwn 19th and 20th, just north of Blue Heron (formerly ‚ÄúStowe‚Äù) Lake Boathouse
column8: Originally created for Burning Man 2024, Naga & The Captainess is a 100-foot-long, 25-foot-tall serpent made of over 5,000 shimmering scales and lit from within. Installed in the weirdly green water of Rainbow Falls Pond (yes! There is a man-made waterfall) near JFK Promenade about 700 feet east of Transervse Drive on San Francisco‚Äôs Golden Mile. The project is a collaboration between local artists Cjay Roughgarden, Stephanie Shipman, and Jacquelyn Scott, with support from arts nonprofit Illuminate, the San Francisco Recreation and Park Department, and a crew of over 250 volunteers. On occasion, Naga even blows bubbles from his nose ‚Äì just in case he wasn‚Äôt magical enough. More than just a sculpture, Naga is the first part of a larger immersive experience still in progress. Plans include a sculptural shipwreck seating area, interactive treasure chests, and a watery street mural meant to inspire connection and play.

column2: Olfactory Portraiture Class at SLATE Gallery
column7: SLATE Gallery 473 25th ste A, Oakland, CA
column8: Scent is art on another plane. Just as you can see contrasts in shape, color, and texture in an art piece‚Äîyou can smell those things too. This workshop, hosted by SLATE gallery, has been designed by olfactory artist Carmen Rose to illuminate the profound connection between scent and memory while teaching participants how to structure a perfume through hands-on experimentation with botanical ingredients. Through this process, students craft an "olfactory portrait"‚Äîa unique personal scent that captures the essence of memories, places, or emotions that exist beyond the visual realm. Carmen provides worksheets and expert guidance throughout the blending process. The workshop takes place in dialogue with Oakland artist Hannah Franco's exhibition TRACES, which explores attention and value through visual narratives descended from women's craft and quilting traditions. Both artists work with the concept of capturing intangible experiences‚Äîand to bridge their artistic practices, Carmen Rose and Hannah Franco have collaborated on a custom scent that translates the ethos of Hannah‚Äôs artwork into fragrance. This signature scent‚Äîavailable for presale at the workshop only‚Äîoffers participants a tangible example of how visual art can be translated into an olfactory experience. Everyone departs with 'a memory in a bottle': their handmade perfume in an elegant 15ml French glass dabber bottle and the knowledge of how it was made.

At Decentered Arts, we want to use technology wherever possible to make sourcing and hosting interesting events seamless. We're excited to share that our events tracker is now powered by AI! column2: The New Sexuality of San Francisco: Sky Daddy and Soft Core with authors Kate Folk and Brittany Newell
column8: Join authors Kate Folk and Brittany Newell in conversation on their recent novels, Sky Daddy and Soft Core. Subverting the classic love story, Folk and Newell spin tales that are surreal, funny, unhinged, and unexpectedly heartwarming. Co-sponsored by The Ruby, a collective of Bay Area nonbinary, transfeminine, and woman-identified creatives About Sky Daddy Linda knows that she can‚Äôt tell anyone she‚Äôs sexually obsessed with planes. Nor can she reveal her belief that it‚Äôs her destiny to ‚Äúmarry‚Äù one of her suitors, uniting with her soulmate plane for eternity. Both subversive and unexpectedly heartwarming, Sky Daddy hijacks the classic love story, exploring desire, fate, and the longing to be accepted for who we truly are. ‚ÄúSleek and darkly comical . . . with the melancholic wit and whimsy of Miranda July.‚Äù‚ÄîThe Boston Globe About Soft Core Ruth is living in a drafty Victorian with her ex-boyfriend Dino, overdosing on television and regretting her master‚Äôs degree. When she starts dancing at a strip club, she becomes Baby Blue, seductress of crypto bros, outcasts, and old lovers alike. Then Dino disappears without a trace. Thus begins a nocturnal quest for the one she still loves; a brutally funny, propulsive story of power, fantasy, love, and loss, Soft Core is an ode to the heartbroken and unhinged, to those whose appetites lead them astray.  ‚ÄúVivid . . . Exhilarating . . . Soft Core is pacey and rich, full of verve, drama and detail.‚Äù ‚ÄîThe New York Times Book Review

column2: Breathwork, Cacao, Soundbath for Clean Water
column8: Donation based - Breathwork , Cacao , and Soundbath with two live sound bath practitioners  We will be serving Cacao from The Mazatec Sierra in Oaxaca to ground ourselves in the present and open our hearts. Cacao supports emotional openness, mental clarity, and heart-centered connection, making it an ideal complement to breathwork and sound. Somatic Breathwork combines ancient wisdom with modern physiology to regulate your nervous system. We'll utilize breathing techniques to discharge stress, unprocessed emotions, trauma, & limiting beliefs. This creates the space to repattern your nervous system & access elevated emotions of deep peace, gratitude, love and purpose. 100% of proceeds from this event are going towards clean water access for over 13,100 people in rural agricultural communities in the region of Esteli Nicaragua. This project is in partnership with La Fem (Fundaci√≥n Entre Mujeres) a non-profit women's empowerment organization based in Nicaragua. They‚Äôve identified clean water as a critical need for 12 of the communities they work in. Unclean water is the leading source of death and malnutrition for children under 5 years globally . You can learn more about the project & donate here: https://www.gofundme.com/f/cleanwaterfor13144 You can also donate via Venmo: solwavesb

column2: Rising Seas 4 with Manilatown Ancestral Ensemble
column8: Connecting culture and climate awareness in creative and engaging ways, Rhythmix Rising Seas presents a free, outdoor series, May through August, transforming Alameda‚Äôs waterfront parks with live music, dance, and theater.  Enjoy the theatrics of the ‚ÄúClimate Detective from the Future‚Äù, directed by Jeff Raz, as he looks for climate clues to find out where things went wrong and where things are headed in a positive direction. Each location tells a unique site-specific story.  Experience the joyful and unifying power of tribal Philippine polyrhythmic percussion, song and dance. Performing the pre-colonial music and dance of Mindanao, Southern Philippines, the Manilatown Ancestral Ensemble weaves stories from indigenous perspectives on the effects of and solutions for climate change. Artists and local climate organizations will offer fun hands-on activities for the community to participate in and learn about actions they can take to help mitigate climate change, inviting everyone to imagine a more connected and sustainable future.  Rhythmix Cultural Works is a proud recipient of the inaugural 2024 Arts in California Parks ‚Äì Local Parks Grant in support of Rising Seas, awarded to only 31 organizations across the state of California. Rising Seas is an anchor arts project of the Rising Tides Climate Arts Initiative supported by Bloomberg Philanthropies and the City of Alameda.

Join us from 3-5pm as fine artist Hannah Franco and olfactory artist Carmen Rose unveil Aither‚Äîthe fourth creation in their Eulogy x HFFA collaborative series. This partnership explores synesthesia, where Carmen‚Äôs perfumes serve as olfactory companions to Hannah‚Äôs oil paintings, translating visual elements like color, texture, and form into aromatic experiences. The collaboration recognizes and elevates scent as art on another plane. Aither draws from Ancient Greek cosmology, capturing the ethereal air that the Greeks believed filled the uppermost region of the sky‚Äîbright blue, shimmering, and divine. This scent was designed as a ritual tool to enhance Hannah‚Äôs creative process, transporting her to that expansive realm where artistic inspiration takes form. Join us to experience Hannah‚Äôs paintings alongside the fragrances they inspired.

column2: "this too, is a gift" - To Much Information #5
column8: "this, too, is a gift", is a rephrasing of a line from the poem The Uses of Sorrow by Mary Oliver: (In my sleep I dreamed this poem) Someone I loved once gave me a box full of darkness. It took me years to understan that this, too, was a gift. "Too Much Information" (TMI) refers to a colloquial expression used to convey the overwhelming feeling that arises when an individual is confronted with an excessive volume of data, details, or content, often to the point of becoming difficult to process or manage effectively. This concept is commonly used to highlight the challenges of navigating a world saturated with information, particularly in the digital age where data is readily accessible and constantly flowing. The phrase is employed across various contexts, ranging from personal experiences to discussions about information overload in fields such as communication, technology, and education.

column2: Gallery Show Opening at The Faight- MIRRORS, by Jenna Hansen
column8: The Faight is pleased to present MIRRORS, a series of quiet confrontations by San Francisco-based artist Jenna Marie Hansen. Across each piece, textured monochromes hum with withheld emotion. Intimacy is rendered in restraint and memory pressed into form. Influenced by the emotional residue of past relationships and the threshold between identity and transformation, Hansen works with acrylic and burl woods‚Äîmaterials chosen for their organic resistance and subtle irregularity.  MIRRORS reflects Hansen‚Äôs personal processing of relational dynamics, exploring how others become surfaces onto which we project, distort, and rediscover ourselves. In tracing these blurred edges and elusive shadows, the work speaks to our shared human experience. Layered linework represents the complexity of connection, the tension between closeness and distance, and the quiet truths that emerge in reflection. Free to attend. Drinks available for purchase. Guests may also purchase tickets to our Sound Pour Event (Jazz and Wine tasting) taking place in our downstairs space that evening. Visit @thefaightsf on Instagram for more details.

column2: THE ART OF BURNING MAN WITH LADYBEE
column8: Ruth‚Äôs Table welcomes LadyBee‚Äîcurator, archivist, and long-time steward of Burning Man‚Äôs artistic legacy‚Äîfor an illuminating evening on The Art of Burning Man. Through stories, images, and her unique perspective, LadyBee will guide us into the history and evolving creative culture of Burning Man, exploring how the event has shaped and been shaped by the artists who bring it to life. The lecture begins at 6:00 PM, followed by a community Q&A. Doors open at 5:30 PM‚Äîcome early to connect, enjoy light refreshments, and settle in. This free program is open to all curious minds, artists, and neighbors ready to spark conversation and share in an evening of collective imagination.

column2: Curious Minds: Reimagining Dementia Capp Street Procession
column8: Dress up in your most colorful, fabulous, and fun attire and join us for a joyful afternoon of creativity, movement, and community! We‚Äôll gather at Ruth‚Äôs Table to make vibrant signs with affirmations like ‚ÄúBe Kind‚Äù and ‚ÄúForgetful but Fabulous.‚Äù Then we‚Äôll set off on a mobile dance party around the block ‚Äî passing by our friends at Community Music Center and 500 Capp Street ‚Äî grooving at an accessible pace with festive costumes, noise makers, and flair. Back at Ruth‚Äôs Table, we‚Äôll enjoy snacks, reflection, and connection. This marks our second year partnering with Reimagining Dementia, and we‚Äôre honored to welcome back Helen Abel, a founding and steering committee member of the Coalition. Together, we‚Äôll celebrate creativity, joy, and humanity while reimagining dementia and breaking down stigma. This procession is also part of our Curious Minds program in collaboration with Jewish Family and Children‚Äôs Services‚Äô Memory Caf√©, a welcoming creative space for elders experiencing memory loss or early-stage dementia and their caregivers.

Let's explore movements of nature through simulation and observation, and see what kind of movement can be inspired in this lab. No need to be a dancer or a scientist‚Äîjust bring your curiosity!

column2: Tactile Anatomy Immersion: Get to Know Your Organs
column8: Our organs keep us alive and in good health‚Äîbut how well do you actually know them in your own body? Can you sense them? Did you know the pancreas feels like a wet bag filled with overcooked oatmeal, or that the heart is more of a vortex than a pump? Join Bex Naj, Elena Lake, and Dr. Myles O'Donnell for a day of organ stories and embodied exploration. Elena will introduce the art of tactile sensing and help you connect with your own innate sensing capacities. Myles will share locations, functions, and textural cues for various abdominal organs, along with stories from their clinical practice. Bex will guide you into the ‚Äúmind‚Äù of each organ through gentle movement, partnered touch, dialogue, and group explorations of organ dynamics.

column2: Arvida Bystr√∂m: In Conversation with Curator Alice Scope
column8: ‚Äã‚ÄãPET is a solo exhibition by Swedish artist Arvida Bystr√∂m, curated by Alice Scope, that examines the emotional structures and dynamics of AI companionship through a cast of anthropomorphized digital avatars‚Äîanimal-coded, face-swapped, and shaped by datasets reflecting male desire. ‚ÄãJoin us for a talk with the artist, Arvida Bystr√∂m, and curator, Alice Scope. Talking about artificial intimacy: What happens when emotional labor is automated, when the interface becomes the object of desire, when ‚Äútalking to someone‚Äù no longer requires anyone at all. And what if a ‚Äòbetter than nothing‚Äô relationship becomes better than anything? column2: BAD ART CLUB // Scribbling Nonsense & Calling It Poetry
column8: Bad Art Club is flipping the script on what makes art "good" or "bad". The point is not what you make, it's how you feel making it. Whoever makes the worst art wins, and zero experience is encouraged. You're likely to gain a lot of inspiration, creative confidence and new friends in the process. So come and write some nonsense with us...for the love of WORDS! Let's play with the ones we know and the ones we make up. Scribble them down on a page and then tear it up. To explain, here's a haiku: Write what's on your mind Scribble what your heart desires Leave somehow different Bad Art Club is an experience unlike any other...so make sure you show up totally unprepared. This is not your typical art class! Best to leave your expectations at the door.

column2: Ravishment Mastery of Erotic Dominance & Passionate Surrender
column8: Ravishment is a hands-on, interactive class that teaches lovers how to create and enjoy the kind of passionate encounters often found in the steamy chapters of romance literature. We will focus on enhancing physical and emotional connection, emphasizing the art of building anticipation, and creating a safe space for exploring dominance and submission (D/s). Embark on a journey of discovery and connection with Ravishment. Through learning the basics of D/s, you will open the door to a more passionate, intimate, and fulfilling relationship. Transform the way you connect with your partner(s), embracing the power and beauty of consensual ravishment. About your instructor: Shelby Devlin is a Sex and Intimacy Coach with over nine years of clinical experience supporting couples and individuals worldwide. She holds a Master‚Äôs in Sexuality Studies, is certified in the Somatica¬Æ Method, an advanced instructor at the Somatica Institute, a certified massage therapist (CMT), and an Associate Practitioner of Ortho-Bionomy. With deep roots in San Francisco‚Äôs kink, non-monogamy, and LGBTQIA+ communities, Shelby brings lived experience, expertise, and compassion to her teaching, helping people shed shame and step fully into joy and self-acceptance.

column2: BAD ART CLUB // "I'm So Not Photogenic" Photo Shoot
column8: Think you look terrible in photos OR tired of looking so damn good in photos? This one‚Äôs for you. Come and f*ck up the beauty construct with us! Expect none of that ‚ÄúSmile!‚Äù, ‚ÄúNow make a silly face!‚Äù, ‚ÄúNow be serious!‚Äù BS‚Ä¶We‚Äôre going to take group photos that are ALIVE, RAW & REAL. The best part is, all you need to do is be you and trust that everyone who shows up to this is a Grade A human, eager to embrace imperfection and make ridiculously bad art together.  Bad Art Club is flipping the script on what makes art "good" or "bad". The point is not what you make, it's how you feel making it. Whoever makes the worst art wins, and zero experience is encouraged. You're likely to gain a lot of inspiration, creative confidence and new friends in the process. This is an experience unlike any other...so make sure you show up totally unprepared. Best to leave your expectations at the door.

At Decentered Arts, we want to use technology wherever possible to make sourcing and hosting interesting events seamless. We're excited to share that our events tracker is now powered by AI! Historically, our team would source and painstakingly copy details from event flyers across the internet manually into our tracker. We're using the latest computer vision models to read event flyers and automagically add to our tracker; so our team can double down on sourcing and hosting! In the spirit of community, our code is open source so anybody can adapt it for their needs! https://github.com/faizan-ali/decentered-events-tracker Built by https://x.com/faizanali94, an SF resident for the past 8 years who's forever bullish on the city. Join us for the first clothing swap at Decentered Studio. This swap series is called Tectonic Threads because the idea is to unite friends from both sides of The Bay. How does a clothing swap work? Bring clothing you want to pass on- (I now dye stained natural fiber items so grungy things are OK) many of us drop in really special easter egg items, or just bring yourself (it's not required to bring things). Peruse other items people have brought and take as much as you'd like. It's not a 1-1 swap. We always have leftovers. Again, you don't have to bring clothes.

column2: Art & Politics: Eric Drooker‚Äôs Naked City
column8: The inimitable Eric Drooker presents his latest graphic novel Naked City in sound and compelling imagery as only he can do it. Political artist and cartoonist Eric Drooker, known for his New Yorker covers and animation for Howl, presents a cartoon concert based on his new graphic novel Naked City. First appearing in our Public Talks series in 2008, and again in 2011, Drooker‚Äôs visual and musical presentations are intimate journeys through his iconic graphic arts. ******** On the edge of town, three bohemians struggle to answer the question: ‚ÄúIs it possible to survive as an artist in the 21st century?‚Äù A young singer with no family hitchhikes to the city and sings her heart out. Late one night, she encounters a street dancer who inspires her to have faith in her music no matter the cost. Desperate for rent money, she poses for a painter who‚Äôs abandoned landscapes for nudes. ‚ÄúDrooker‚Äôs comment on the sacrifices inherent to the pursuit of the arts feels both timeless and of-the-moment, thanks to his spot-on critique of late capitalism. Any creative to ever question their craft or purpose will find themselves reflected here.‚Äù‚ÄîPublishers Weekly This is part of a series of solo artists giving a behind the scenes and in depth look at what inspires them in the interrelationship between art and politics.

‚ÄãAnother matchmaking experiment: My gf asks me to help find Gabriel a husband (and move to sf with her). Here‚Äôs what she has to say: Date my friend Gabriel! He‚Äôs visiting from Miami, and is looking for a bf (and also a job ;) [1]) I think Gabriel would vibe well with: - People who are family oriented and community oriented. He has a great relationship with his mom & sister, literally the most friendly person I know (can talk to anyone on the street), and cares for his friends really well! His person would also imagine having a commune with friends, rather than two people alone off the woods - someone who has explored their emotions deeply. Growing up Gabriel had a lot of struggles with money, queerness, religion (ask him abt his life story!!) but through each event he grows more whole. He would match really well with someone who has similarly thought very deeply about life. If you prioritize your career over everything else you might not be a good match.- you need to be cute (personality & personhood), tyvm. If he actually gets married from this event I get first dib on bridesmaid!!!! Gabriel is 28 and open to dating men aged 24-36. He wants kids. [1] Looking for PM and Project management roles. Especially in fintechs but open to other industries Please bring some kind of drink or snack if you can. 7‚Äì8:30 PM.

Since my teen years, I‚Äôve considered photography my first medium‚Äî a long lost love of archiving and presenting how I see the world around me. These images show the beauty in the raw unpretentiousness of San Francisco nightlife through the use of disposable cameras. My goal in using disposable cameras as my tool is to show how the need for inaccessible and highly expensive gear is unnecessary when you utilize your eye and intuition. This exhibit is my resurgence as a photographic archiver‚Äî capturing moments of joy, resistance and unapologetic queerness.

column8: Are we just the result of a chaotic collision of cells, or has our journey already begun before we take our first breath?  The Fetus Show is an absurd, comedic exploration of birth, our baggage, and the grand cosmic joke of the interwovenness of it all. From conception, to the womb, to our  coming to the world, Jessica Farber invites audiences to examine the substance of what we inherit, what we carry, what we find and what we inevitably lose and leave behind.

Join Shaping San Francisco and friends for a spirited hike and rambling conversation(s) as we traverse the Panhandle freeway route, seeing the hundreds of buildings that would have been destroyed, and imagining a world without the Panhandle Park, instead seeing a freeway interchange as it plunged into a tunnel beneath Golden Gate Park. A favorite theme for us to cover, the Freeway Revolt of the 1950s and 1960s, was one of the largest and most successful ongoing citizen protests in San Francisco‚Äôs history. The revolt against the California Division of Highways‚Äô plan to extend freeways across the city became the first serious opposition in the nation to the post-WWII consensus on automobiles, freeways, and suburbanization.

What happens when the manliest of men gets a little too manly for us to handley? My Lil‚Äô Guy follows the unnecessary journey of a clown who goes to town on his masculinity, only to find herself face-to-face with their humanity. Trigger Warning: themes of sexual violence. Post-Trigger Warning: follow-up themes of guttural vengeance. Feral Child

Join us Oct 4, 5:30-7:30PM for the opening reception for Catherine Wagner‚Äôs Blue Reverie, featuring a special performance entitled ‚ÄúBlue Moon‚Äù and a temporary sonic work installed in the upstairs closet by artist Nathan Kosta. Wagner‚Äôs culminating exhibition of new work, Blue Reverie, seeks to forge linkages and lineages between the evocative, introspective nature of the color blue, its symbolism in history and music, and the environmental archive of the House. In Blue Reverie, the visuality of blue becomes an invitation, positioning itself as a channel to observe David Ireland‚Äôs legacy in a newly-imagined environment.

column2: BAD ART CLUB // G-Rated Figurative(ly) Drawing
column8: Bad Art Club is flipping the script on what makes art "good" or "bad". The point is not what you make, it's how you feel making it. Whoever makes the worst art wins, and zero experience is encouraged. You're likely to gain a lot of inspiration, creative confidence and new friends in the process. This session is a live drawing "un-class", where you likely won‚Äôt get any better at drawing people, but you will definitely start to see them in a new light. This isn‚Äôt a ‚Äúdraw me like one of your French girls‚Äù experience‚Äîthe only thing we‚Äôll be taking off is our masks. What happens if we look past appearances and draw what we discover there? I don‚Äôt know‚Ä¶let‚Äôs find out?! Bad Art Club is an experience unlike any other...so make sure you show up totally unprepared. This is not your typical art class! Best to leave your expectations at the door.

At Decentered Arts, we want to use technology wherever possible to make sourcing and hosting interesting events seamless. We're excited to share that our events tracker is now powered by AI! Historically, our team would source and painstakingly copy details from event flyers across the internet manually into our tracker. We're using the latest computer vision models to read event flyers and automagically add to our tracker; so our team can double down on sourcing and hosting! In the spirit of community, our code is open source so anybody can adapt it for their needs! https://github.com/faizan-ali/decentered-events-tracker Built by https://x.com/faizanali94, an SF resident for the past 8 years who's forever bullish on the city. We still encourage submissions.

From the echoes of historic broadcasts to the vibrant sounds of live bands, this event has something for everyone. Admission is free. Registration is not required, but the first 150 people to RSVP on Eventbrite receive a free drink ticket. More info on 2blocksofart.org.

This series runs from October 16 to December 18th. What to expect: A small group, hands-on series focused on safety, technical skill, body awareness, and connection in partial suspensions. This is where floorwork begins to lift off. They‚Äôll build on solid foundational ties and harnesses to explore how vertical elements can deepen connection, expand creativity, and open up new possibilities for intentional, engaging scenes on the path toward full suspension.This series will fill up quickly! About your instructors: Davide (rope top) has studied Shibari for over a decade, blending influences from Kanna-ry≈´ and Naka-ry≈´. A respected Bay Area teacher, he‚Äôs performed internationally and loves building community through rope. Gina (rope switch and bottoming instructor) has tied and bottomed for over a decade, with primary influences from Akira Naka and Nicolas Arnoys. She focuses on helping rope bottoms stay safe, tune into their desires, and bottom in ways that feel most fulfilling.

column2: Hadar Rising Song Group: Unlocking Joy in Community Spaces
column7: Chochmat Halev, 2215 Prince Street, Berkeley, CA 94705
column8: What would make us the most happy in the world? If more people sang together in community spaces! Thanks to a generous grant from the Hadar Rising Song Institute, the Hadar Rising Song Group was born in Berkeley to help bring singers together in community spaces. What are we singing? wordless melodies; yep they are melodies that don't have words to them. Do I need to be a good singer to come and sing? Absolutely not! In fact, beginners instrumentalists who don't normally sing are encouraged to participate in this workshop. Come by and experience the joy of singing together with artsy people, musicians and joy seekers in community spaces! No previous experience necessary. Drop-In Welcome. No Cover Charge. All Ages and ability levels are welcome. LGBTQ+ friendly <3!

column7: The Radical Reading Room, 438 Haight St, San Francisco, CA 94117
column8: The Present Moment Game is an experimental social meditation practice that invites you to frame yourself squarely in the Here & Now. So much of our time with others is spent reliving the past or projecting into the future. In fact, it‚Äôs surprisingly rare to really be with someone in the moment, even when we‚Äôre right there with them. But what if we had a way to fully meet one another, right in the Here & Now? The Present Moment Game is an hour-long social meditation experience that offers a simple yet powerful technique to help people drop into full presence.

column2: Full Body Sensory Music Journey w/ Zendo Stereo + Crescendo
column7: Berkeley Chapel of the Flowers, 3049 Adeline Street Berkeley, CA 94703
column8: Join us for an immersive, full-body listening experience that invites you to slow down, tune in, and journey inward through music and vibration. This guided journey is a unique collaboration, combining Zendo Stereo methodology with Crescendo Research‚Äôs groundbreaking tactile audio technology for a collective journey through music.Experience the music through a Crescendo tactile floor, a room-sized somatic speaker that envelops your whole body with vibration and let music transport you beyond your imagination. Feel the deep resonance of the music through your body, not just your ears, enhancing the emotional impact of every note. You‚Äôll be guided through Zendo Stereo, a deep listening ritual that blends thoughtfully curated music with simple yet powerful practices designed to down-regulate the nervous system, open space for inner reflection, and reconnect you with your deeper self.

Gratitude and Hope for the Future The country needs an informed and engaged citizenry now, more than ever. Views of Democracy: Gratitude and Hope for the Future celebrates democracy through the eyes of visual artists. Visitors will enjoy the breadth and diversity of the work‚Äìfrom video to sculpture and from painting to photography, textile art and mixed media. Accompanying artists‚Äô statements, are both personal and universal and encourage reflection on democracy and citizenship. Join the artists from Views of Democracy and the leaders of Citizen Joy as we reflect on what‚Äôs next for us. Presented by Citizen Joy. Curated by Jeff Raz and Barbara Kibbe.

This guided journey is a unique collaboration, combining Zendo Stereo methodology with Crescendo Research‚Äôs groundbreaking tactile audio technology for a collective journey through music.Experience the music through a Crescendo tactile floor, a room-sized somatic speaker that envelops your whole body with vibration and let music transport you beyond your imagination. Feel the deep resonance of the music through your body, not just your ears, enhancing the emotional impact of every note. You‚Äôll be guided through Zendo Stereo, a deep listening ritual that blends thoughtfully curated music with simple yet powerful practices designed to down-regulate the nervous system, open space for inner reflection, and reconnect you with your deeper self.

‚ÄãWe have prepared an algorithm to drive the movement state shift in the Markov Chain game. Also a visualization of how things move in nature, like a piece of wood floating in an ocean wave, or a leaf in the wind. Let's explore movements of nature through simulation and observation, and see what kind of movement can be inspired in this lab. No need to be a dancer or a scientist‚Äîjust bring your curiosity!

On Halloween we're gathering to organize a tribute to one of San Francisco's earliest gay bars: the Black Cat Cafe. We'll have a bouquet-making workshop at 6pm at Nova Express then cross the street to lay our flowers at 7pm and hear stories of drag queens outwitting cops, bohemians drinking wine with artists and subversives, and brave patrons singing loudly to jailed homosexuals across the intersection.

column2: BEYOND BORDER WALLS 2025: Voices from Near & Far
column7: 1st Unitarian Universalist Church, 1187 Franklin St, San Francisco, CA 94109, United States
column8: Hear music transcend boundaries as Filipino voices blend with the much-loved Misa Criolla from Argentina, and a WORLD PREMIERE from Bay Area composer Benjamin Gribble, titled Last Light - Symphony No. 1. ¬∂ The Golden Gate Symphony Orchestra & Chorus‚Äô musical journey spans continents, featuring works by one of SF‚Äôs favorite composers, John Calloway, alongside Lucio San Pedro's Filipino masterpiece Lahing Kayumanggi featuring the Bay Area‚Äôs very own Kulintang Dialect. ¬∂ Kulintang Dialect‚Äîled by Conrad Benedicto honors the legacy of traditional Filipino gong music, and they perform alongside the full Golden Gate Symphony Orchestra & Chorus with soloists Celeste Camarena (alto) and Christopher Poston (tenor), and under the direction of Maestro Urs Leonhardt Steiner. ¬∂ This marks the fourth installment in GGSOC's Beyond the Border Wall concert series, a meaningful tradition designed to remind audiences that music unites us across all barriers. Each concert in this series celebrates the universal language of music that flows freely between cultures, creating bridges where walls might divide.

column2: BEYOND BORDER WALLS 2025: Voices from Near & Far
column7: 1st Unitarian Universalist Church, 1187 Franklin St, San Francisco, CA 94109, United States
column8: Hear music transcend boundaries as Filipino voices blend with the much-loved Misa Criolla from Argentina, and a WORLD PREMIERE from Bay Area composer Benjamin Gribble, titled Last Light - Symphony No. 1.  The Golden Gate Symphony Orchestra & Chorus‚Äô musical journey spans continents, featuring works by one of SF‚Äôs favorite composers, John Calloway, alongside Lucio San Pedro's Filipino masterpiece Lahing Kayumanggi featuring the Bay Area‚Äôs very own Kulintang Dialect. Kulintang Dialect‚Äîled by Conrad Benedicto honors the legacy of traditional Filipino gong music, and they perform alongside the full Golden Gate Symphony Orchestra & Chorus with soloists Celeste Camarena (alto) and Christopher Poston (tenor), and under the direction of Maestro Urs Leonhardt Steiner. This marks the fourth installment in GGSOC's Beyond the Border Wall concert series, a meaningful tradition designed to remind audiences that music unites us across all barriers. Each concert in this series celebrates the universal language of music that flows freely between cultures, creating bridges where walls might divide.
